title: Basic bars
description: Very simple bars generated from a JSON
code:
<g-composer>
  <template>
    <svg viewBox="0 0 200 100" width="200px" height="100px">
      <g stroke-width="12" stroke-linecap="round">
        <g g-for="(record, index) of data">
          <line
            x1="22"
            g-bind:x2="30 + record.value"
            g-bind:y1="30 + (index * 20)"
            g-bind:y2="30 + (index * 20)"
            g-bind:stroke="record.color"
          ></line>
        </g>
      </g>
    </svg>
  </template>
  <script type="data">
    [
      { color: "#D80000", value: 100 },
      { color: "#00D800", value: 150 },
      { color: "#0000D8", value: 70 },
    ]
  </script>
</g-composer>

      </g>
    </svg>

title: bump chart
description: This image is a bump chart illustrating the changes in rankings of different categories over time. Each colored line represents a distinct category (labeled A to J on the right side). The dots along the lines indicate the rank of each category at different time points, with the lines showing how rankings rise or fall as they move from left to right.
code:
<g-composer id="example">
  <template>
    <svg viewBox="0 0 500 500" height="500" width="500" font-size="12">
      <g g-for="(player, n) of data[data.length - 1]">
        <circle
          r="12"
          stroke="lightgray"
          stroke-width="1"
          cx="485"
          g-bind:fill="$.config.pallete[n]"
          g-bind:cy="66 + (n * 45)"
          g-content="n + 1"
        ></circle>
        <text
          text-anchor="middle"
          x="485"
          g-bind:y="70 + (n * 45)"
          g-content="player"
        ></text>
      </g>
      <g g-for="(ranking, i) of data">
        <g g-for="(player, n) of ranking">
          <line
            g-if="i !== data.length - 1"
            g-bind:x1="30 + (i * 44)"
            g-bind:y1="66 + (n * 45)"
            g-bind:x2="30 + ((i+1) * 44)"
            g-bind:y2="66 + (data[i+1].indexOf(data[i][n]) * 45)"
            g-bind:stroke="$.config.pallete[data[data.length - 1].indexOf(player)]"
            stroke-width="1"
          ></line>
          <circle
            r="6"
            stroke="gray"
            stroke-width="1"
            g-bind:fill="$.config.pallete[data[data.length - 1].indexOf(player)]"
            g-bind:cx="30 + (i * 44)"
            g-bind:cy="66 + (n * 45)"
          >
            <title g-content="player"></title>
          </circle>
        </g>
      </g>
    </svg>
  </template>
  <script type="data">
    [
      ["D", "J", "C", "G", "B", "I", "F", "A", "H", "E"],
      ["C", "G", "D", "I", "J", "B", "F", "H", "A", "E"],
      ["C", "D", "I", "G", "J", "F", "B", "A", "E", "H"],
      ["C", "G", "D", "J", "I", "B", "F", "H", "E", "A"],
      ["D", "C", "G", "J", "I", "B", "E", "F", "H", "A"],
      ["D", "J", "C", "G", "B", "I", "E", "F", "H", "A"],
      ["D", "C", "G", "B", "J", "I", "F", "A", "E", "H"],
      ["D", "J", "C", "G", "B", "I", "F", "E", "A", "H"],
      ["J", "D", "C", "B", "I", "G", "F", "H", "A", "E"],
      ["J", "D", "G", "C", "I", "F", "B", "A", "H", "E"],
    ]
  </script>
  <script type="config">
    {
      pallete: [
        "#8dd3c7",
        "#bed3b3",
        "#bebada",
        "#fb8072",
        "#80b1d3",
        "#fdb462",
        "#b3de69",
        "#fccde5",
        "#d9d9d9",
        "#bc80bd",
      ],
    }
  </script>
</g-composer>

title: Circle bars
description: This graphic visualizes the data using curved bar arcs. Each value is represented by a bar arc, whose length and curvature reflect the respective value for that group.

title: clock
description: Realtime update
code:
<g-composer id="example">
  <template>
    <svg viewBox="0 0 250 250" g-on:init="init">
      <circle
        cx="125"
        cy="125"
        r="124"
        stroke="#000"
        stroke-width="2"
        fill="none"
      ></circle>
      <g g-for="n of 60">
        <line
          g-bind:x1="$.polar2cartesian(125, 125, n % 5 ? 115 : 110, n * 6).x"
          g-bind:y1="$.polar2cartesian(125, 125, n % 5 ? 115 : 110, n * 6).y"
          g-bind:x2="$.polar2cartesian(125, 125, 120, n * 6).x"
          g-bind:y2="$.polar2cartesian(125, 125, 120, n * 6).y"
          g-bind:stroke-width="n % 5 ? 1 : 2"
          stroke="#000"
        ></line>
      </g>
      <g g-for="n of 12">
        <text
          g-bind:x="$.polar2cartesian(125, 127, 95, (n + 1) * 30).x"
          g-bind:y="$.polar2cartesian(125, 127, 95, (n + 1) * 30).y"
          g-content="n + 1"
          font-size="18"
          font-family="sans-serif"
          alignment-baseline="middle"
          text-anchor="middle"
        ></text>
      </g>
      <g fill="#000" stroke="#555" stroke-width="1">
        <polygon
          g-bind:transform="$$.rotate(date.getSeconds() * 6, 125, 125)"
          points="125,20,129,125,125,145,124,125"
        ></polygon>
        <polygon
          g-bind:transform="$$.rotate(date.getMinutes() * 6, 125, 125)"
          points="125,30,130,125,125,150,120,125"
        ></polygon>
        <polygon
          g-bind:transform="$$.rotate((date.getHours() % 12 * 30) + (date.getMinutes() * 0.5), 125, 125)"
          points="125,60,130,125,125,160,120,125"
        ></polygon>
      </g>
    </svg>
  </template>
  <script type="data">
    { date: new Date() }
  </script>
  <script type="methods">
    function init() {
      setInterval(() => ($.data.date = new Date()), 1000);
    }
  </script>
  <script
    type="plugin"
    src="https://cdn.graphery.online/graphane/1.0.0-beta/plugins/shapes.js"
  ></script>
</g-composer>

title: Comparison CEOs in Fortune 500 companies by gender
description: This graphic highlights the gender disparity among CEOs in Fortune 500 companies. The semicircle represents the overwhelming majority of male CEOs at 90%, while the smaller segment indicates the 10% occupied by women.
code:
<g-composer id="example">
  <template>
    <svg viewBox="0 0 500 600">
      <text x="250" y="50" text-anchor="middle" font-size="30">
        CEOs in Fortune 500 companies
      </text>
      <path
        g-bind:style="{fill: $.config.colors[0]}"
        g-bind:d="$$.barArc(250, 280, (180 * data[0].value / 2) + 20, 180 * data[0].value, 180, -135)"
      ></path>
      <path
        g-bind:style="{fill: $.config.colors[1]}"
        g-bind:d="$$.barArc(250, 280, (180 * data[1].value / 2) + 20 , 180 * data[1].value, 180, 45)"
      ></path>
      <line
        x1="250"
        y1="300"
        x2="250"
        y2="550"
        stroke="black"
        stroke-width="2"
        stroke-dasharray="10"
      ></line>
      <g g-bind:stroke="$.config.colors[0]">
        <text x="220" y="530" text-anchor="end" font-size="30">
          <tspan g-content="data[0].label"></tspan>
        </text>
        <text x="220" y="570" text-anchor="end" font-size="30">
          <tspan g-content="data[0].value * 100"></tspan>
          %
        </text>
      </g>
      <g g-bind:stroke="$.config.colors[1]">
        <text x="270" y="530" text-anchor="start" font-size="30">
          <tspan g-content="data[1].label"></tspan>
        </text>
        <text x="270" y="570" text-anchor="start" font-size="30">
          <tspan g-content="data[1].value * 100"></tspan>
          %
        </text>
      </g>
    </svg>
  </template>
  <script type="data">
    [
      { label: "man", value: 0.9 },
      { label: "woman", value: 0.1 },
    ]
  </script>
  <script type="config">
    { colors: ["#629d23", "#5E239D"] }
  </script>
  <script
    type="plugin"
    src="https://cdn.graphery.online/graphane/1.0.0-beta/plugins/shapes.js"
  ></script>
</g-composer>

title: Word population
description: from 1955 to 2020
code:
<g-composer id="example">
  <template>
    <svg
      viewBox="0 0 600 400"
      width="600"
      height="400"
      style="font-size: 14px;"
    >
      <g g-for="([key, value], n) of Object.entries(data)">
        <text x="0" g-bind:y="(n * 22) + 60" g-content="key"></text>
        <rect
          x="40"
          width="500"
          height="18"
          fill="lightgray"
          g-bind:y="(n * 22) + 45"
        ></rect>
        <rect
          x="40"
          height="18"
          fill="black"
          g-bind:y="(n * 22) + 45"
          g-bind:width="500 * value / 8000000000"
        >
          <title g-content="new Intl.NumberFormat().format(value)"></title>
        </rect>
      </g>
      <g g-for="n of 8">
        <text
          y="370"
          text-anchor="middle"
          g-bind:x="(500 * (n + 1) / 8) + 40"
          g-content="(n + 1) * 1000"
        ></text>
        <line
          g-bind:x1="(500 * (n + 1) / 8) + 40"
          g-bind:x2="(500 * (n + 1) / 8) + 40"
          y1="42"
          y2="350"
          stroke="gray"
          stroke-width="1"
        ></line>
      </g>
      <text y="35" x="3">year</text>
      <text y="390" x="520">millions</text>
    </svg>
  </template>
  <script type="data">
    {
      "1955": 2746072141,
      "1960": 3019233434,
      "1965": 3337111983,
      "1970": 3695390336,
      "1975": 4069437231,
      "1980": 4444007706,
      "1985": 4861730613,
      "1990": 5316175862,
      "1995": 5743219454,
      "2000": 6148898975,
      "2005": 6558176119,
      "2010": 6985603105,
      "2015": 7426597537,
      "2020": 7840952880,
    }
  </script>
</g-composer>

title: Heatmap
code:
<g-composer id="example">
  <template>
    <svg
      viewBox="0 0 600 200"
      width="600"
      height="200"
      style="font-size: 12px;"
    >
      <g g-for="(day, d) of data">
        <text
          x="0"
          g-bind:y="(d * 20) + 45"
          g-content="new Date(1970, 1, d+2).toLocaleString('en',{weekday:'short'})"
        ></text>
        <g g-for="(hour, h) of day">
          <text
            y="24"
            g-bind:x="(h * 20) + 32"
            g-content="String(h + 1).padStart(2,'0')"
          ></text>
          <rect

            g-bind:x="h * 20"
            g-bind:y="d * 20"

          </rect>

        <text x="580" g-bind:y="(n * 20) + 26" g-content="value"></text>
        <rect
          x="550"
          width="20"
          height="20"
          stroke="black"
          stroke-width="1"
          g-bind:y="(n * 20) + 10"

title: line chart
code:
<g-composer id="line-chart">
  <template>
    <svg
      viewBox="0 0 600 200"
      width="600"
      height="200"
      style="font-size: 12px;"
    >
      <polyline
        fill="none"
        stroke="blue"
        stroke-width="2"
        g-bind:points="data.map((v, n) => [(n * 560 / data.length) + 39, 160 - ((v / (Math.ceil(data.$max() / 10) * 10)) * 150)])"
      ></polyline>
      <g g-for="n of 7">
        <text
          x="10"
          g-bind:y="(n * 25) + 14"
          font-size="11"
          g-content="Math.round(Math.ceil(data.$max() / 10) * 10 / 6 * (6 - n))"
        ></text>
        <line
          stroke="black"
          stroke-width="0.5"
          x1="40"
          x2="576"
          g-bind:y1="(n * 25) + 10"
          g-bind:y2="(n * 25) + 10"
        ></line>
      </g>
      <g g-for="(v, n) of data">
        <text
          font-size="11"
          y="180"
          g-bind:x="(n * 560 / data.length) + 35"
          g-content="n"
        ></text>
        <line
          stroke="black"
          stroke-width="0.5"
          y1="10"
          y2="160"
          g-bind:x1="(n * 560 / data.length) + 39"
          g-bind:x2="(n * 560 / data.length) + 39"
        ></line>
        <circle
          r="3"
          fill="red"
          g-bind:cx="(n * 560 / data.length) + 39"
          g-bind:cy="160 - ((v / (Math.ceil(data.$max() / 10) * 10)) * 150)"
        >
          <title g-content="v"></title>
        </circle>
      </g>
    </svg>
  </template>
  <script type="data">
    [
      6, 7, 23, 14, 8, 3, 19, 18, 11, 15, 21, 20, 2, 22, 10, 1, 9, 13, 24, 12, 17,
      16, 4, 5,
    ]
  </script>
</g-composer>

title: Quadrants
code:
<g-composer id="example" style="width: 250px; height: 250px;">
  <template>
    <svg viewBox="0 0 120 120">
      <line
        x1="60"
        y1="10"
        x2="60"
        y2="110"
        stroke-width="1"
        stroke="lightgrey"
      ></line>
      <line
        x1="10"
        y1="60"
        x2="110"
        y2="60"
        stroke-width="1"
        stroke="lightgrey"
      ></line>
      <g g-for="(value, key) of data">
        <circle
          r="3"
          g-bind:cx="value.x + 10"
          g-bind:cy="value.y + 10"
        ></circle>
        <text
          g-content="'option ' + key"
          g-bind:x="value.x > 50 ? value.x - 22 : value.x + 15"
          g-bind:y="value.y + 12"
          style="font-size: 7px;"
        ></text>
      </g>
    </svg>
  </template>
  <script type="data">
    {
      a: { x: 10, y: 40 },
      b: { x: 65, y: 12 },
      c: { x: 32, y: 23 },
      d: { x: 24, y: 80 },
      e: { x: 92, y: 62 },
    }
  </script>
</g-composer>

title: Radial chart
description: Top population countries
code:
<g-composer id="example" style="width: 500px;">
  <template>
    <svg viewBox="0 0 500 500">
      <g g-for="({country, population}, n) of data">
        <g
          g-bind:transform="$$.translate(
                             Object.values(
                               $.polar2cartesian(250, 250, 170 * population / data.$max('population')+ 10, 360/data.length * n + 360/data.length/2 ) ) )"
        >
          <g
            g-bind:transform="$$.rotate(360/data.length * n + (360/data.length * n < 180 ? -70:110))"
            g-bind:text-anchor="360/data.length * n >= 180 ? 'end' : ''"
          >
            <text
              alignment-baseline="middle"
              font-size="12"
              g-content="country"
            ></text>
          </g>
        </g>
        <path
          g-bind:d="$$.circleSlice( 250, 250, 170 * (population / data.$max('population')), 360/data.length, 360/data.length * n )"
          fill="red"
          stroke="white"
          stroke-width="1"
        ></path>
      </g>
    </svg>
  </template>
  <script type="data">
    [
      { country: "India", population: 1428627663 },
      { country: "China", population: 1425671352 },
      { country: "United States", population: 339996563 },
      { country: "Indonesia", population: 277534122 },
      { country: "Pakistan", population: 240485658 },
      { country: "Nigeria", population: 223804632 },
      { country: "Brazil", population: 216422446 },
      { country: "Bangladesh", population: 172954319 },
      { country: "Russia", population: 144444359 },
      { country: "Mexico", population: 128455567 },
      { country: "Ethiopia", population: 126527060 },
      { country: "Japan", population: 123294513 },
    ]
  </script>
  <script
    type="plugin"
    src="https://cdn.graphery.online/graphane/1.0.0-beta/plugins/shapes.js"
  ></script>
</g-composer>

title: Ranking evolution
code:
<g-composer id="ranking-evolution">
  <template>
    <svg
      viewBox="0 0 500 500"
      height="500"
      width="500"
      font-size="12"
      style="border: 1px solid rgb(128, 128, 128);"
    >
      <g g-for="(ranking, i) of data">
        <g g-for="(player, n) of ranking">
          <circle
            r="12"
            stroke="gray"
            stroke-width="1"
            g-bind:fill="$.config.pallete[data[data.length - 1].indexOf(player)]"
            g-bind:cx="30 + (i * 450)"
            g-bind:cy="26 + (n * 50)"
          ></circle>
          <text
            text-anchor="middle"
            g-bind:x="30 + (i * 450)"
            g-bind:y="30 + (n * 50)"
            g-content="player"
          ></text>
        </g>
      </g>
      <g g-for="(player, n) of data[0]">
        <path
          g-bind:d="$$.M(42, 26 + (n * 50))
                    .C(300, 26 + (n * 50), 
                       200, 26 + (data[1].indexOf(data[0][n]) * 50), 
                       468, 26 + (data[1].indexOf(data[0][n]) * 50))"
          g-bind:stroke="$.config.pallete[data[0].indexOf(player)]"
          stroke-width="1"
          fill="none"
        ></path>
      </g>
    </svg>
  </template>
  <script type="data">
    [
      ["D", "J", "C", "G", "B", "I", "A", "F", "H", "E"],
      ["C", "E", "G", "D", "I", "F", "B", "H", "J", "A"],
    ]
  </script>
  <script type="config">
    {
      pallete: [
        "#8dd3c7",
        "#bed3b3",
        "#bebada",
        "#fb8072",
        "#80b1d3",
        "#fdb462",
        "#b3de69",
        "#fccde5",
        "#d9d9d9",
        "#bc80bd",
      ],
    }
  </script>
</g-composer>

title: Survey result
code:
<g-composer id="example">
  <template>
    <svg
      g-bind:viewbox="[0, 0, 600, (data.length + 2) * 30]"
      g-bind:height="(data.length + 2) * 30"
      width="600"
      font-size="11"
    >
      <line
        stroke="black"
        x1="300"
        x2="300"
        y1="48"
        g-bind:y2="42 + (data.length  * 30)"
        stroke-width="1"
      ></line>
      <g g-for="(record, n) of data">
        <text
          g-content="record.question"
          dominant-baseline="hanging"
          text-anchor="end"
          g-bind:x="290 - (Math.max(...data.map(r => r.somewhat_oppose + r.strongly_oppose)) / 100 * 200)"
          g-bind:y="(n * 30) + 55"
        ></text>
        <rect
          class="sto"
          fill="darkred"
          height="20"
          g-bind:x="300 - (record.somewhat_oppose / 100 * 200) - (record.strongly_oppose / 100 * 200)"
          g-bind:y="(n * 30) + 50"
          g-bind:width="record.strongly_oppose / 100 * 200"
        >
          <title g-content="record.strongly_oppose + '%'"></title>
        </rect>
        <rect
          class="soo"
          fill="red"
          height="20"
          g-bind:x="300 - (record.somewhat_oppose / 100 * 200)"
          g-bind:y="(n * 30) + 50"
          g-bind:width="record.somewhat_oppose / 100 * 200"
        >
          <title g-content="record.somewhat_oppose + '%'"></title>
        </rect>
        <rect
          class="sof"
          fill="green"
          height="20"
          x="301"
          g-bind:y="(n * 30) + 50"
          g-bind:width="record.somewhat_favor / 100 * 200"
        >

<g-composer id="example">
  <template>
    <svg
      g-bind:viewbox="[0, 0, (data.length * 100) + 30, 300]"
      g-bind:width="(data.length * 100) + 30"
      height="300"
      font-size="11"
    >
      <line
        x1="0"
        g-bind:x2="data.length * 100"
        y1="150"
        y2="150"
        stroke-width="1"
        stroke="black"
      ></line>
      <g g-for="({label, description}, n) of data">
        <g>
          <text
            g-content="label"
            dominant-baseline="middle"
            text-anchor="middle"
            g-bind:x="n * 100 + 50"
            g-bind:y="n % 2 ? 120 : 180"
          ></text>
          <circle cy="150" r="4" fill="black" g-bind:cx="n * 100 + 50"></circle>
          <line
            stroke-width="1"
            stroke="black"
            y1="150"
            g-bind:x1="n * 100 + 50"
            g-bind:y2="n % 2 ? 130 : 170"
            g-bind:x2="n * 100 + 50"
          ></line>
          <foreignObject
            height="80"
            width="130"
            g-bind:x="n * 100"
            g-bind:y="n % 2 ? 20 : 200"
            g-content="description"
            style="line-height: 1.2em;"

      </g>

  </template>

title: Treemap
code:
<g-composer id="example" style="width: 500px;">
  <template>
    <svg viewBox="0 0 600 600" width="600">
      <g
        g-for="({x, y, width, height}, n) of createTreeMap(data.map(x => x.population))"
      >
        <rect
          g-bind:x="x"
          g-bind:y="y"
          g-bind:width="width"
          g-bind:height="height"
          stroke="white"
          fill="lightgreen"
        ></rect>
        <text
          fill="black"
          g-bind:x="x + 10"
          g-bind:y="y + 24"
          g-content="data[n].country"
        ></text>
        <text
          fill="black"
          g-bind:x="x + 10"
          g-bind:y="y + 48"
          g-content="Math.round(data[n].population / 1000000) + ' millions'"
        ></text>
        <g
          g-for="({x: x2, y: y2, width: width2, height: height2}, i) of createTreeMap(data[n].values.map(x => x.population), width, height, x, y)"
        >
          <rect
            g-bind:x="x2"
            g-bind:y="y2"
            g-bind:width="width2"
            g-bind:height="height2"
            stroke="white"
            fill="green"
          ></rect>
          <text
            fill="white"
            g-bind:x="x2 + 10"
            g-bind:y="y2 + 24"
            g-content="data[n].values[i].country"
          ></text>
          <text
            fill="white"
            g-bind:x="x2 + 10"
            g-bind:y="y2 + 48"
            g-content="Math.round(data[n].values[i].population / 1000000) + ' millions'"
          ></text>
        </g>
      </g>
    </svg>
  </template>
  <script type="data">
    [
      {
        country: "top 7",
        population: 4152542436,
        values: [
          { country: "India", population: 1428627663 },
          { country: "China", population: 1425671352 },
          { country: "United States", population: 339996563 },
          { country: "Indonesia", population: 277534122 },
          { country: "Pakistan", population: 240485658 },
          { country: "Nigeria", population: 223804632 },
          { country: "Brazil", population: 216422446 },
        ],
      },
      { country: "rest of the world", population: 4107326789, values: [] },
    ]
  </script>
  <script type="methods">
    function createTreeMap(data, width = 600, height = 600, x = 0, y = 0) {
      if (data.length == 0) {
        return [];
      } else if (data.length == 1) {
        return [{ x, y, width, height }];
      } else {
        let mid = Math.floor(data.length / 2);
        let total = data.reduce((a, b) => a + b, 0);
        let sum1 = data.slice(0, mid).reduce((a, b) => a + b, 0);
        let sum2 = data.slice(mid).reduce((a, b) => a + b, 0);
        let ratio = sum1 / total;
        if (width > height) {
          return [
            ...createTreeMap(data.slice(0, mid), width * ratio, height, x, y),
            ...createTreeMap(
              data.slice(mid),
              width * (1 - ratio),
              height,
              x + width * ratio,
              y,
            ),
          ];
        } else {
          return [
            ...createTreeMap(data.slice(0, mid), width, height * ratio, x, y),
            ...createTreeMap(
              data.slice(mid),
              width,
              height * (1 - ratio),
              x,
              y + height * ratio,
            ),
          ];
        }
      }
    }
  </script>
</g-composer>

          g-bind:id="`rect_` + i"
          g-bind:cx="Math.floor(i / 20) * 20 + 5"

      { label: "b", votes: 15, color: "green" },
    ]
  </script>

title: Otto Neurath tribute
W. E. B. Du Bois Tribute: Labor Distribution Visualization
description: This graphic pays tribute to W. E. B. Du Bois by illustrating the labor distribution across various sectors for two racial groups—“negroes” and “whites.” Using a circular segmentation inspired by Du Bois’s visual storytelling, the graphic represents sectors such as agriculture, domestic work, manufacturing, transportation, and professional occupations.
code:
<g-composer id="color">
  <template>
    <svg viewBox="0 0 500 500" width="500" style="font-family: monospace;">
      <filter id="filter">
        <feTurbulence
          result="noise-lg"
          type="fractalNoise"
          baseFrequency=".04"
          numOctaves="1"
          seed="1458"
        ></feTurbulence>
        <feComposite
          result="BaseGraphic"
          in="SourceGraphic"
          in2="noise-lg"
          operator="arithmetic"
          k1="0.5"
          k2="0.6"
          k4="-.07"
        ></feComposite>
        <feComposite
          operator="arithmetic"
          k1="-0.8"
          k2="0.8"
          k3="1.4"
        ></feComposite>
      </filter>
      <g g-for="(group, x) of data.$distinct('group')">
        <text
          x="250"
          g-bind:y="x ? 480 : 30"
          text-anchor="middle"
          g-content="group.toUpperCase()"
        ></text>
        <g g-for="(record, n, all) of data.filter(r => r.group === group)">
          <path
            stroke="#c0c0c0"
            stroke-width="1"
            filter="url(#filter)"
            g-bind:transform="x ? $$.rotate(180,250,250) : ''"
            g-bind:fill="$.config.colors[n]"
            g-bind:check="group + ' ' + record.sector"
            g-bind:d="$$.circleSlice( 250, 
                                    250, 
                                    200,
                                    120 * record.value,
                                    (120 * data.$sum(all.filter((r,x) => x < n), 'value')) -60,
                                  )"
          ><title g-content="record.sector"></title></path>
        </g>
      </g>
    </svg>
  </template>
  <script type="data">

    "group";"sector";"value";
    "negroes";"agriculture";0.62;
    "negroes";"domestic";0.28;
    "negroes";"manufacturing";0.05;
    "negroes";"transportation";0.045;
    "negroes";"professions";0.005;
    "whites";"agriculture";0.64;
    "whites";"domestic";0.055;
    "whites";"manufacturing";0.135;
    "whites";"transportation";0.13;
    "whites";"professions";0.04;
  </script>
  <script type="config">
    { colors: ["#cd143c", "#ffd700", "#4682b4", "#d2b38c", "#654321"] }
  </script>
  <script
    type="plugin"
    src="https://cdn.graphery.online/graphane/1.0.0-beta/plugins/shapes.js"
  ></script>
</g-composer>

title: Line Length
description: A bar chart uses line lengths to represent different values, making it easy to compare numbers at a glance. It's popular because these line lengths are simple to interpret and the bars are uniformly thick, allowing for quick and clear visual comparisons.
code:
<g-composer>
  <template>
    <svg viewBox="0 0 500 500" width="500" height="500" font-size="14">
      <g g-for="(info, n) of data">
        <text 
          style="font-family: Helvetica, Verdana, sans-serif; fill:#333333"
          g-content="info.text"
          height="16"
          width="100"
          g-bind:x="8"
          g-bind:y="(56*n)+36"></text>
        <rect          
          height="16"
          g-bind:x="8"
          g-bind:y="(56*n)+40"
          g-bind:width="info.hours*100"
          g-bind:fill="info.color"
          rx="1"
        ></rect>
      </g>
    </svg>
  </template>
  <script type="data">
    [
      {
        text: "Social networks",
        hours: 2.5,
        color: "#007EA7"
      },
      {
        text: "Messaging",
        hours: 1.5,
        color: "#FFE066"
      },
      {
        text: "Games",
        hours: 1.2,
        color: "#414288"
      },
      {
        text: "Calls",
        hours: 0.8,
        color: "#F25F5C"
      },
      {
        text: "Internet browsing",
        hours: 1.8,
        color: "#6CAE75"
      },
      {
        text: "Other applications",
        hours: 1.2,
        color: "#E86A92"
      }
      
    ]
  </script>
</g-composer>

title: Circles countable
description: Using countable line lengths or dots to represent quantities makes data easy to read and compare without tools. Grouping dots in fives helps with quick counting.
code:
<g-composer>
  <template>
    <svg viewBox="0 0 500 500" width="500" height="500" font-size="14">
      <g g-for="(info, n) of data">
        <text
          style="font-family: Helvetica, Verdana, sans-serif; fill:#333333"
          g-content="info.text"
          x="2"
          g-bind:y="(56*n)+26"
        ></text>
        <g g-for="circleIndex of Math.ceil(info.hours * 10)">
          <circle
            g-bind:cx="8 + circleIndex * 20"
            g-bind:cy="(56*n)+40"
            r="8"
            g-bind:fill="info.color"
          ></circle>
        </g>
      </g>
    </svg>
  </template>
  <script type="data">
    [
      {
        text: "Social networks",
        hours: 2.5,
        color: "#007EA7",
      },
      {
        text: "Messaging",
        hours: 1.5,
        color: "#FFE066",
      },
      {
        text: "Games",
        hours: 1.2,
        color: "#414288",
      },
      {
        text: "Calls",
        hours: 0.8,
        color: "#F25F5C",
      },
      {
        text: "Internet browsing",
        hours: 1.8,
        color: "#6CAE75",
      },
      {
        text: "Other applications",
        hours: 1.2,
        color: "#E86A92",
      },
    ]
  </script>
</g-composer>

title: Circle size
description: This graphic uses circles to represent quantities, with their sizes reflecting different values. Each circle's radius is scaled based on the data, and each circle is positioned randomly within the SVG area.
code:
<g-composer>
  <template>
    <svg
      viewBox="0 0 500 500"
      width="500"
      height="500"
      font-size="14"
      text-anchor="middle"
    >
      <g g-for="(info, n) of completeData(data)">
        <circle
          :cx="info.cx || 0"
          :cy="info.cy || 0"
          :r="info.hours * 20"
          :fill="info.color"
        ></circle>
        <text
          style="font-family: Helvetica, Verdana, sans-serif; fill:#000000;"
          g-content="info.text"
          :x="info.cx"
          :y="info.cy"
        ></text>
        <text
          style="font-family: Helvetica, Verdana, sans-serif; fill:#CCCCCC"
          g-content="'('+ info.hours +')'"
          :x="info.cx"
          :y="info.cy + 15"
        ></text>
      </g>
    </svg>
  </template>
  <script type="data">
    [
      { text: "Social networks", hours: 2.5, color: "#007EA7" },
      { text: "Messaging", hours: 1.5, color: "#FFE066" },
      { text: "Games", hours: 1.2, color: "#414288" },
      { text: "Calls", hours: 0.8, color: "#F25F5C" },
      { text: "Internet browsing", hours: 1.8, color: "#6CAE75" },
      { text: "Other applications", hours: 1.2, color: "#E86A92" },
    ]
  </script>
  <script type="methods">
    const maxAttempts = 100;
    const processedData = [];

    function completeData(baseData) {
      baseData.forEach((info) => {
        const radius = info.hours * 20;
        const position = generateRandomPosition(processedData, radius);
        info.cx = position.cx;
        info.cy = position.cy;
        processedData.push({ cx: info.cx, cy: info.cy, r: radius });
      });

      return baseData;
    }

    function generateRandomPosition(existingCircles, radius) {
      let position;
      let validPosition = false;
      let attempts = 0;

      while (!validPosition && attempts < maxAttempts) {
        attempts++;
        const randomX = Math.random() * 250 + 50;
        const randomY = Math.random() * 250 + 50;
        position = { cx: randomX, cy: randomY };

        validPosition = existingCircles.every((circle) => {
          const dx = circle.cx - position.cx;
          const dy = circle.cy - position.cy;
          const distance = Math.sqrt(dx * dx + dy * dy);
          return distance >= circle.r + radius + 16; // 16 padding
        });
      }

      return position;
    }
  </script>
</g-composer>

title: Pie chart
description: When all quantities add up to 100 percent and each value is calculated as a percentage of a 360-degree circle, we get a pie chart. Its popularity stems from how easily computer software can create it.
code:
<g-composer>
  <template>
    <svg viewBox="0 0 500 500" width="500" height="500">
      <g g-for="(slice, n) of completeData(data)">
        <path
          g-bind:d="slice.pathData"
          g-bind:fill="slice.color"
          stroke="#fff"
          stroke-width="2"
        ></path>
        <text
          style="font-family: Helvetica, Verdana, sans-serif; fill:#fff"
          g-content="slice.text"
          g-bind:x="slice.textX"
          g-bind:y="slice.textY"
        ></text>
      </g>
    </svg>
  </template>
  <script type="data">
    [
      //Total percentage must add up to 100%.
      { name: "Internet browsing", percentage: 20, color: "#6CAE75" },
      { name: "Messaging", percentage: 16, color: "#E6C440" },
      { name: "Calls", percentage: 9, color: "#F25F5C" },
      { name: "Games", percentage: 13, color: "#414288" },
      { name: "Other", percentage: 13, color: "#E86A92" },
      { name: "Social networks", percentage: 29, color: "#007EA7" },
    ]
  </script>
  <script type="methods">
    const cx = 250;
    const cy = 250;
    const r = 200;

    function coords(angle) {
      const arad = (Math.PI / 180) * angle;
      return {
        x: cx + r * Math.cos(arad),
        y: cy + r * Math.sin(arad),
      };
    }

    function dGajo(startAngle, endAngle) {
      const startCoords = coords(startAngle);
      const endCoords = coords(endAngle);

      return `M${cx},${cy} L${startCoords.x},${startCoords.y} A${r},${r} 0 0,1 ${endCoords.x},${endCoords.y} Z`;
    }

    function completeData(data) {
      let startAngle = 0;
      return data.map((slice) => {
        const endAngle = startAngle + (slice.percentage * 360) / 100;
        const pathData = dGajo(startAngle, endAngle);
        startAngle = endAngle;
        const centerX =
          cx +
          (r / 2) *
            Math.cos(
              (Math.PI / 180) * (startAngle - (slice.percentage * 180) / 100),
            );
        const centerY =
          cy +
          (r / 2) *
            Math.sin(
              (Math.PI / 180) * (startAngle - (slice.percentage * 180) / 100),
            );
        return {
          pathData,
          color: slice.color,
          text: slice.name,
          textX: centerX - 30,
          textY: centerY,
        };
      });
    }
  </script>
</g-composer>

title: Donut
description: This diagram works like a pie chart but is better for displaying additional information in the center, such as a total number. It's commonly called a donut chart.
code:
<g-composer>
  <template>
    <svg viewBox="0 0 500 500" width="500" height="500">
      <g g-for="(slice, n) of completeData(data)">
        <path
          g-bind:d="slice.pathData"
          g-bind:fill="slice.color"
          stroke="#fff"
          stroke-width="2"
        ></path>
      </g>
      <g g-for="(slice,n) of data">
        <circle
          cx="205"
          g-bind:cy="(14*n)+218"
          r="4"
          g-bind:fill="slice.color"
        ></circle>
        <text
          style="font-family: Helvetica, Verdana, sans-serif; fill:#000"
          g-content="slice.name"
          x="220"
          g-bind:y="(14*n)+222"
          text-anchor="left"
          font-size="12"
        ></text>
      </g>
    </svg>
  </template>
  <script type="data">
    [
      // The total percentage must sum up to 100%
      { name: "Internet browsing", percentage: 20, color: "#6CAE75" },
      { name: "Messaging", percentage: 16, color: "#FFE066" },
      { name: "Calls", percentage: 9, color: "#F25F5C" },
      { name: "Games", percentage: 13, color: "#414288" },
      { name: "Other", percentage: 13, color: "#E86A92" },
      { name: "Social networks", percentage: 29, color: "#007EA7" },
    ]
  </script>
  <script type="methods">
    const cx = 250;
    const cy = 250;
    const outerRadius = 200;
    const innerRadius = 100;

    function coords(angle, radius) {
      const arad = (Math.PI / 180) * angle;
      return {
        x: cx + radius * Math.cos(arad),
        y: cy + radius * Math.sin(arad),
      };
    }

    function dDonut(startAngle, endAngle) {
      const outerStartCoords = coords(startAngle, outerRadius);
      const outerEndCoords = coords(endAngle, outerRadius);
      const innerStartCoords = coords(startAngle, innerRadius);
      const innerEndCoords = coords(endAngle, innerRadius);

      return `M${outerStartCoords.x},${outerStartCoords.y}
                          A${outerRadius},${outerRadius} 0 0,1 ${outerEndCoords.x},${outerEndCoords.y}
                          L${innerEndCoords.x},${innerEndCoords.y}
                          A${innerRadius},${innerRadius} 0 0,0 ${innerStartCoords.x},${innerStartCoords.y}
                          Z`;
    }

    function completeData(data) {
      let startAngle = 0;
      return data.map((slice) => {
        const endAngle = startAngle + (slice.percentage * 360) / 100;
        const pathData = dDonut(startAngle, endAngle);
        startAngle = endAngle;
        return {
          pathData,
          color: slice.color,
        };
      });
    }
  </script>
</g-composer>

title: Arc chart
description: This arc-shaped chart displays different activities, with each segment sized according to its percentage. The segments vary in radius and are color-coded.
code:
<g-composer>
  <template>
    <svg viewBox="0 0 500 500" width="500" height="500">
      <g g-for="(slice, n) of completeData(data)">
        <path
          g-bind:d="slice.pathData"
          g-bind:fill="slice.color"
          stroke="#fff"
          stroke-width="2"
        ></path>
        <text
          style="font-size:9px; font-family: Helvetica, Verdana, sans-serif; fill:#fff"
          g-content="slice.text"
          g-bind:x="slice.textX"
          g-bind:y="slice.textY"
        ></text>
      </g>
    </svg>
  </template>
  <script type="data">
    [
      // The total percentage must add up to 100%
      { name: "Internet browsing", percentage: 20, color: "#6CAE75" },
      { name: "Messaging", percentage: 16, color: "#FFE066" },
      { name: "Calls", percentage: 9, color: "#F25F5C" },
      { name: "Games", percentage: 13, color: "#414288" },
      { name: "Other", percentage: 13, color: "#E86A92" },
      { name: "Social networks", percentage: 29, color: "#007EA7" },
    ]
  </script>
  <script type="methods">
    const cx = 250;
    const cy = 250;
    const baseRadius = 100;
    const maxRadius = 300;

    function coords(angle, radius) {
      const arad = (Math.PI / 180) * angle;
      return {
        x: cx + radius * Math.cos(arad),
        y: cy + radius * Math.sin(arad),
      };
    }

    function dSegment(startAngle, endAngle, radius) {
      const startCoords = coords(startAngle, radius);
      const endCoords = coords(endAngle, radius);

      return `M${cx},${cy} L${startCoords.x},${startCoords.y} A${radius},${radius} 0 0,1 ${endCoords.x},${endCoords.y} Z`;
    }

    function completeData(data) {
      let startAngle = 180;
      return data.map((slice) => {
        const radius =
          baseRadius + ((maxRadius - baseRadius) * slice.percentage) / 100;
        // Adjust for half arc (180 degrees), can be set to 360 for foot chart
        const endAngle = startAngle + (slice.percentage * 180) / 100;
        const pathData = dSegment(startAngle, endAngle, radius);
        startAngle = endAngle;
        const centerX =
          cx +
          (radius / 2) *
            Math.cos(
              (Math.PI / 180) * (startAngle - (slice.percentage * 90) / 100),
            );
        const centerY =
          cy +
          (radius / 2) *
            Math.sin(
              (Math.PI / 180) * (startAngle - (slice.percentage * 90) / 100),
            );
        return {
          pathData,
          color: slice.color,
          text: slice.name,
          textX: centerX - 10,
          textY: centerY - 10,
        };
      });
    }
  </script>
</g-composer>

title: Typical chart
description: A typical coordinate system consists of two axes that open up space for placing values with two dimensions at an exact position.
code:
<g-composer>
  <template>
    <svg viewBox="0 0 500 500" width="500" height="500">
      <!-- X-Axis -->
      <g>
        <line
          x1="50"
          y1="50"
          x2="450"
          y2="50"
          stroke="#000"
          stroke-width="2"
        ></line>
        <text
          style="font-family: Helvetica, Verdana, sans-serif;"
          x="460"
          y="53"
          font-size="11"
          g-content="'X'"
        ></text>
      </g>
      <!-- Y-Axis -->
      <g>
        <line
          x1="50"
          y1="450"
          x2="50"
          y2="50"
          stroke="#000"
          stroke-width="2"
        ></line>
        <text
          style="font-family: Helvetica, Verdana, sans-serif;"
          x="45"
          y="468"
          font-size="11"
          g-content="'Y'"
        ></text>
      </g>
      <!-- X-Axis Divisions -->
      <g g-for="n of 10">
        <text
          style="font-family: Helvetica, Verdana, sans-serif;"
          y="470"
          g-bind:x="20"
          g-bind:y="452 - (n * 40)"
          font-size="11"
          g-content="n * 10"
        ></text>
        <line
          stroke="grey"
          stroke-width="0.5"
          x1="40"
          x2="450"
          g-bind:y1="(n * 40) + 90"
          g-bind:y2="(n * 40) + 90"
        ></line>
      </g>

      <!-- Y-Axis Divisions -->
      <g g-for="n of 10">
        <line
          g-bind:x1="(n * 40) + 50"
          y1="40"
          g-bind:x2="(n * 40) + 50"
          y2="450"
          stroke="grey"
          stroke-width="0.5"
        ></line>
        <text
          style="font-family: Helvetica, Verdana, sans-serif;"
          y="30"
          g-bind:x="(n * 40) + 50"
          font-size="11"
          g-content="n * 10"
        ></text>
      </g>

      <!-- Points on the Graph -->
      <g g-for="(point, n) of completeData(data)">
        <circle
          g-bind:cx="point.x"
          g-bind:cy="point.y"
          r="5"
          g-bind:fill="point.color"
        ></circle>
        <text
          style="font-family: Helvetica, Verdana, sans-serif; fill:#000"
          g-content="point.label"
          g-bind:x="point.x + 10"
          g-bind:y="point.y - 10"
        ></text>
      </g>
    </svg>
  </template>
  <script type="data">
    [
      { label: "Point A", xValue: 10, yValue: 20, color: "#FF5733" },
      { label: "Point B", xValue: 30, yValue: 40, color: "#33FF57" },
      { label: "Point C", xValue: 50, yValue: 10, color: "#3357FF" },
      { label: "Point D", xValue: 70, yValue: 60, color: "#F1C40F" },
      { label: "Point E", xValue: 90, yValue: 80, color: "#9B59B6" },
    ]
  </script>
  <script type="methods">
    const xScale = 4;
    const yScale = 4;
    const xOffset = 50;
    const yOffset = 450; 

    function completeData(data) {
      return data.map((point) => {
        const x = xOffset + point.xValue * xScale;
        const y = yOffset - point.yValue * yScale;
        return {
          x,
          y,
          color: point.color,
          label: point.label,
        };
      });
    }
  </script>
</g-composer>

title: Simple chart
description: A typical coordinate system consists of two axes that open up space for placing values with two dimensions at an exact position.
code:
<g-composer>
  <template>
    <svg viewBox="0 0 500 500" width="500" height="500">
      <!-- X-Axis -->
      <g>
        <line
          x1="50"
          y1="450"
          x2="450"
          y2="450"
          stroke="#000"
          stroke-width="2"
        ></line>
        <text
          style="font-family: Helvetica, Verdana, sans-serif;"
          x="460"
          y="465"
          font-size="12"
          g-content="'X'"
        ></text>
      </g>

      <!-- Y-Axis -->
      <g>
        <line
          x1="50"
          y1="50"
          x2="50"
          y2="450"
          stroke="#000"
          stroke-width="2"
        ></line>
        <text
          style="font-family: Helvetica, Verdana, sans-serif;"
          x="35"
          y="45"
          font-size="12"
          g-content="'Y'"
        ></text>
      </g>

      <!-- X-Axis Scale Divisions -->
      <g g-for="n of 10">
        <text
          style="font-family: Helvetica, Verdana, sans-serif;"
          y="470"
          g-bind:x="(n * 40) + 50"
          font-size="11"
          g-content="n * 10"
        ></text>
        <line
          stroke="grey"
          stroke-width="0.5"
          x1="50"
          x2="450"
          g-bind:y1="450 - (n * 40)"
          g-bind:y2="450 - (n * 40)"
        ></line>
      </g>

      <!-- Y-Axis Scale Divisions -->
      <g g-for="n of 10">
        <text
          style="font-family: Helvetica, Verdana, sans-serif;"
          x="30"
          g-bind:y="450 - (n * 40) + 5"
          font-size="11"
          g-content="n * 10"
        ></text>
        <line
          g-bind:x1="50 + (n * 40)"
          y1="50"
          g-bind:x2="50 + (n * 40)"
          y2="450"
          stroke="grey"
          stroke-width="0.5"
        ></line>
      </g>

      <!-- Data Points -->
      <g g-for="(point, n) of completeData(data)">
        <circle
          g-bind:cx="point.x"
          g-bind:cy="point.y"
          r="5"
          g-bind:fill="point.color"
        ></circle>
        <text
          style="font-family: Helvetica, Verdana, sans-serif; fill:#000"
          g-content="point.label"
          g-bind:x="point.x + 8"
          g-bind:y="point.y - 8"
          font-size="10"
        ></text>
      </g>
    </svg>
  </template>
  <script type="data">
    [
      { label: "A", xValue: 10, yValue: 20, color: "#FF5733" },
      { label: "B", xValue: 30, yValue: 40, color: "#33FF57" },
      { label: "C", xValue: 50, yValue: 10, color: "#3357FF" },
      { label: "D", xValue: 70, yValue: 60, color: "#F1C40F" },
      { label: "E", xValue: 90, yValue: 80, color: "#9B59B6" },
    ]
  </script>
  <script type="methods">
    const xScale = 4;
    const yScale = 4;
    const xOffset = 50;
    const yOffset = 450;

    function completeData(data) {
      return data.map((point) => {
        const x = xOffset + point.xValue * xScale;
        const y = yOffset - point.yValue * yScale;
        return {
          x,
          y,
          color: point.color,
          label: point.label,
        };
      });
    }
  </script>
</g-composer>

title: Polar chart
description: A polar coordinate chart that displays data points around a central point, with concentric circles and radial lines indicating different levels and angles.
code:
<g-composer>
  <template>
    <svg viewBox="0 0 500 500" width="500" height="500">
      <!-- Background Circle -->
      <circle
        cx="250"
        cy="250"
        r="200"
        stroke="#ccc"
        stroke-width="2"
        fill="none"
      ></circle>

      <!-- Polar Grid (Radius and Angles) -->
      <g g-for="n of 5">
        <circle
          cx="250"
          cy="250"
          g-bind:r="n * 40"
          stroke="lightgrey"
          stroke-width="1"
          fill="none"
        ></circle>
        <text
          style="font-family: Helvetica, Verdana, sans-serif; fill:#aaa;"
          g-bind:x="255 + (n * 40)"
          y="250"
          font-size="12"
          g-content="n"
        ></text>
      </g>
      <g g-for="(angle, n) of [0, 45, 90, 135, 180, 225, 270, 315]">
        <line
          x1="250"
          y1="250"
          g-bind:x2="250 + 200 * Math.cos((Math.PI / 180) * angle)"
          g-bind:y2="250 + 200 * Math.sin((Math.PI / 180) * angle)"
          stroke="lightgrey"
          stroke-width="1"
        ></line>
      </g>

      <!-- Data Points -->
      <g g-for="(point, n) of completeData(data)">
        <circle
          g-bind:cx="point.x"
          g-bind:cy="point.y"
          r="5"
          g-bind:fill="point.color"
        ></circle>
        <text
          style="font-size:10px; font-family: Helvetica, Verdana, sans-serif; fill:#000"
          g-content="point.label"
          g-bind:x="point.x + 10"
          g-bind:y="point.y - 10"
        ></text>
      </g>
    </svg>
  </template>
  <script type="data">
    [
      //radius max 200
      { label: "A", angle: 30, radius: 100, color: "#FF5733" },
      { label: "B", angle: 90, radius: 120, color: "#33FF57" },
      { label: "C", angle: 150, radius: 80, color: "#3357FF" },
      { label: "D", angle: 210, radius: 150, color: "#F1C40F" },
      { label: "E", angle: 270, radius: 130, color: "#9B59B6" },
    ]
  </script>
  <script type="methods">
    const cx = 250;
    const cy = 250;

    function completeData(data) {
      return data.map((point) => {
        const x = cx + point.radius * Math.cos((Math.PI / 180) * point.angle);
        const y = cy + point.radius * Math.sin((Math.PI / 180) * point.angle);
        return {
          x,
          y,
          color: point.color,
          label: point.label,
        };
      });
    }
  </script>
</g-composer>

title: Circles chart
description: A chart composed of multiple circles, where the quantity of circles represents the proposed data.
code:
<g-composer>
  <template>
    <svg
      viewBox="0 0 500 500"
      width="500"
      height="500"
      font-size="14"
      text-anchor="middle"
    >
      <!-- Data Points and Labels -->
      <g g-for="(info, n) of completeData(data)">
        <!-- Circles for each data point -->
        <g g-for="(circle, n) of info.circles">
          <circle
            g-bind:cx="circle.cx"
            g-bind:cy="circle.cy"
            r="8"
            g-bind:fill="info.color"
          ></circle>
        </g>

        <!-- Text labels for each data point -->
        <text
          style="font-family: Helvetica, Verdana, sans-serif; fill:#000000;"
          g-content="info.text"
          g-bind:x="info.cx"
          g-bind:y="info.cy + 45"
        ></text>
        <text
          style="font-family: Helvetica, Verdana, sans-serif; fill:#CCCCCC"
          g-content="'('+ info.hours +')'"
          g-bind:x="info.cx"
          g-bind:y="info.cy + 65"
        ></text>
      </g>
    </svg>
  </template>
  <script type="data">
    [
      { text: "Social networks", hours: 2.5, color: "#007EA7" },
      { text: "Messaging", hours: 1.5, color: "#FFE066" },
      { text: "Games", hours: 1.2, color: "#414288" },
      { text: "Calls", hours: 0.8, color: "#F25F5C" },
      { text: "Internet browsing", hours: 1.8, color: "#6CAE75" },
      { text: "Other applications", hours: 1.2, color: "#E86A92" },
    ]
  </script>
  <script type="methods">
    function completeData(baseData) {
      const maxRadius = 25; // Maximum distance from the center for random placement
      const minDistance = 20; // Minimum distance between circles to prevent overlap

      baseData.forEach((info, index) => {
        const numberOfCircles = Math.ceil(info.hours * 2); // Multiply by 2 to get the number of circles

        const baseX = 100 + (index % 3) * 150; 
        const baseY = 100 + Math.floor(index / 3) * 150;

        info.cx = baseX;
        info.cy = baseY;

        info.circles = [];

        for (let i = 0; i < numberOfCircles; i++) {
          let positionFound = false;
          let attempts = 0;

          while (!positionFound && attempts < 100) {
            attempts++;
            const angle = Math.random() * 2 * Math.PI;
            const radius = Math.random() * maxRadius // Random distance from the center

            const newCircle = {
              cx: baseX + radius * Math.cos(angle),
              cy: baseY + radius * Math.sin(angle),
            };

            // Check for overlap
            positionFound = info.circles.every(existingCircle => {
              const dx = existingCircle.cx - newCircle.cx;
              const dy = existingCircle.cy - newCircle.cy;
              const distance = Math.sqrt(dx * dx + dy * dy);
              return distance >= minDistance;
            });

            if (positionFound) {
              info.circles.push(newCircle);
            }
          }
        }
      });

      return baseData;
    }
  </script>
</g-composer>

title: Arc chart (with function data())
description: This arc-shaped chart displays different activities, with each segment sized according to its percentage. The segments vary in radius and are color-coded.
code:
<g-composer>
  <template>
    <svg viewBox="0 0 500 500" width="500" height="500">
      <g g-for="(slice, n) of data">
        <path
          g-bind:d="slice.pathData"
          g-bind:fill="slice.color"
          stroke="#fff"
          stroke-width="2"
        ></path>
        <text
          style="font-size:9px; font-family: Helvetica, Verdana, sans-serif; fill:#fff"
          g-content="slice.text"
          g-bind:x="slice.textX"
          g-bind:y="slice.textY"
        ></text>
      </g>
    </svg>
  </template>
  <script type="data">
    [
      // The total percentage must add up to 100%
      { name: "Internet browsing", percentage: 20, color: "#6CAE75" },
      { name: "Messaging", percentage: 16, color: "#FFE066" },
      { name: "Calls", percentage: 9, color: "#F25F5C" },
      { name: "Games", percentage: 13, color: "#414288" },
      { name: "Other", percentage: 13, color: "#E86A92" },
      { name: "Social networks", percentage: 29, color: "#007EA7" },
    ]
  </script>
  <script type="methods">
    const cx = 250;
    const cy = 250;
    const baseRadius = 100;
    const maxRadius = 300;

    function coords(angle, radius) {
      const arad = (Math.PI / 180) * angle;
      return {
        x: cx + radius * Math.cos(arad),
        y: cy + radius * Math.sin(arad),
      };
    }

    function dSegment(startAngle, endAngle, radius) {
      const startCoords = coords(startAngle, radius);
      const endCoords = coords(endAngle, radius);

      return `M${cx},${cy} L${startCoords.x},${startCoords.y} A${radius},${radius} 0 0,1 ${endCoords.x},${endCoords.y} Z`;
    }

    function data(data) {
      let startAngle = 180;
      return data.map((slice) => {
        const radius =
          baseRadius + ((maxRadius - baseRadius) * slice.percentage) / 100;
        // Adjust for half arc (180 degrees), can be set to 360 for foot chart
        const endAngle = startAngle + (slice.percentage * 180) / 100;
        const pathData = dSegment(startAngle, endAngle, radius);
        startAngle = endAngle;
        const centerX =
          cx +
          (radius / 2) *
            Math.cos(
              (Math.PI / 180) * (startAngle - (slice.percentage * 90) / 100),
            );
        const centerY =
          cy +
          (radius / 2) *
            Math.sin(
              (Math.PI / 180) * (startAngle - (slice.percentage * 90) / 100),
            );
        return {
          pathData,
          color: slice.color,
          text: slice.name,
          textX: centerX - 10,
          textY: centerY - 10,
        };
      });
    }
  </script>
</g-composer>

title: Radially chart
description: A radial chart with lines extending from a central point. Each line's length represents "data" for different categories, with labels at the ends showing the category
code:
<g-composer>
  <template>
    <svg
      viewBox="0 0 500 500"
      width="500"
      height="500"
      font-size="12"
      text-anchor="middle"
    >
      <g g-for="(info, n) of completeData(data)">
        <line
          x1="250"
          y1="250"
          g-bind:x2="info.x2"
          g-bind:y2="info.y2"
          stroke="#79c7c0"
          stroke-width="10"
        >
        </line>
        <text
          g-bind:x="info.x2"
          g-bind:y="info.y2"
          g-content="info.label"
          g-bind:transform="info.textTransform"
          style="font-family: Helvetica, Verdana, sans-serif;"
        ></text>
      </g>
      <circle cx="250" cy="250" fill="#79c7c0" r="5"></circle>
    </svg>
  </template>
  <script type="data">
    [
      // Assume maximum hours is 100 for scaling
      { label: "Social networks (75)", hours: 75 },
      { label: "Messaging (45)", hours: 45 },
      { label: "Games (36)", hours: 36 },
      { label: "Calls (22)", hours: 22 },
      { label: "Internet browsing (54)", hours: 54 },
      { label: "Other applications (36)", hours: 36 },
    ]
  </script>
  <script type="methods">
    function completeData(data) {
      const centerX = 250;
      const centerY = 250;
      const scaleFactor = 2.5; // Factor to scale hours to length

      const angleStep = -150 / data.length; //Determine the opening degrees of the graph, you can set it to 360 degrees, so that it is a circle.

      return data.map((item, index) => {
        const angle = angleStep * index * (Math.PI / 180);
        const length = item.hours * scaleFactor;
        const x2 = centerX + length * Math.cos(angle);
        const y2 = centerY + length * Math.sin(angle);

        // Adjust textTransform to flip if angle is beyond 90 or below -90 degrees
        const angleDegrees = angleStep * index;
        let textTransform = `rotate(${angleDegrees} ${x2} ${y2})`;
        if (angleDegrees < -90) {
          textTransform += ` rotate(180 ${x2} ${y2})`;
        }

        return {
          ...item,
          x2,
          y2,
          textTransform,
        };
      });
    }
  </script>
</g-composer>

title: Radial dashed chart
description: This graphic features a central circle with dashed lines extending outward. Each line represents an activity, with its length proportional to the hours spent on that activity.
code:
<g-composer>
  <template>
    <svg
      viewBox="0 0 500 500"
      width="500"
      height="500"
      font-size="12"
      text-anchor="middle"
    >
      <g g-for="(info, n) of completeData(data)">
        <line
          g-bind:x1="info.x1"
          g-bind:y1="info.y1"
          g-bind:x2="info.x2"
          g-bind:y2="info.y2"
          stroke="#79c7c0"
          stroke-width="4"
          stroke-linecap="round"
          stroke-dasharray="10, 10"
        ></line>
        <text
          g-bind:x="info.x2"
          g-bind:y="info.y2 - 10"
          g-content="info.label"
          g-bind:transform="info.textTransform"
          style="font-family: Helvetica, Verdana, sans-serif;"
        ></text>
      </g>
      <circle
        id="centerCircle"
        cx="250"
        cy="250"
        stroke="#79c7c0"
        fill="none"
        g-bind:r="$.config.circleRadius[0]"
        stroke-width="4"
        stroke-linecap="round"
        stroke-dasharray="10, 10"
      ></circle>
    </svg>
  </template>
  <script type="data">
    [
      // Assume maximum hours is 100 for scaling
      { label: "Social networks (75)", hours: 75 },
      { label: "Messaging (45)", hours: 45 },
      { label: "Games (36)", hours: 36 },
      { label: "Calls (22)", hours: 22 },
      { label: "Internet browsing (54)", hours: 54 },
      { label: "Other applications (36)", hours: 36 },
    ]
  </script>
  <script type="methods">
    function completeData(data) {
      const centerX = 250;
      const centerY = 250;

      const angleStep = 360 / data.length;
      return data.map((item, index) => {
        const angle = angleStep * index * (Math.PI / 180);

        // Calculate the starting point on the circumference of the center circle
        const x1 = centerX + $.config.circleRadius[0] * Math.cos(angle);
        const y1 = centerY + $.config.circleRadius[0] * Math.sin(angle);

        // Calculate the end point of the line
        const length = item.hours * $.config.scaleFactor[0];
        const x2 = centerX + ($.config.circleRadius[0] + length) * Math.cos(angle);
        const y2 = centerY + ($.config.circleRadius[0] + length) * Math.sin(angle);

        // Adjust textTransform to flip if angle is beyond 90 or below -90 degrees
        const angleDegrees = angleStep * index;
        let textTransform = `rotate(${angleDegrees} ${x2} ${y2})`;
        if (angleDegrees > 90 && angleDegrees < 270) {
          textTransform += ` rotate(180 ${x2} ${y2})`;
        }

        return {
          ...item,
          x1,
          y1,
          x2,
          y2,
          textTransform,
        };
      });
    }
  </script>
  <script type="config">
    {
      circleRadius: [20], // Radius of the center circle
      scaleFactor: [2], // Factor to scale hours to length
    }
  </script>
</g-composer>

title: Sun chart
description: This graph looks like a sun, it is composed of a semicircle and several radial lines that represent the data.
code:
<g-composer>
  <template>
    <svg
      viewBox="0 0 500 500"
      width="500"
      height="500"
      font-size="12"
      text-anchor="middle"
    >
      <!-- Draw lines and text -->
      <g g-for="(info, n) of completeData(data)">
        <line
          g-bind:x1="info.x1"
          g-bind:y1="info.y1"
          g-bind:x2="info.x2"
          g-bind:y2="info.y2"
          stroke="#79c7c0"
          stroke-width="8"
        ></line>
        <text
          g-bind:x="info.x2"
          g-bind:y="info.y2 - 10"
          g-content="info.label"
          g-bind:transform="info.textTransform"
          style="font-family: Helvetica, Verdana, sans-serif;"
        ></text>
      </g>

      <!-- Center semicircle -->
      <path
        d="
          M 250,250 
          L 200,250 
          A 50,50 0 0,1 300,250 
          Z
        "
        fill="none"
        stroke="#79c7c0"
        stroke-width="8"
      ></path>
    </svg>
  </template>
  <script type="data">
    [
      // Assume maximum hours is 100 for scaling
      { label: "Social networks (75)", hours: 75 },
      { label: "Messaging (45)", hours: 45 },
      { label: "Games (36)", hours: 36 },
      { label: "Calls (22)", hours: 22 },
      { label: "Internet browsing (54)", hours: 54 },
      { label: "Other applications (36)", hours: 36 },
    ]
  </script>
  <script type="methods">
    function completeData(data) {
      const centerX = 250;
      const centerY = 250;

      const angleStep = -180 / data.length;

      return data.map((item, index) => {
        const angle = angleStep * index * (Math.PI / 180);

        // Calculate the starting point on the circumference of the center circle
        const x1 = centerX + $.config.circleRadius * Math.cos(angle);
        const y1 = centerY + $.config.circleRadius * Math.sin(angle);

        // Calculate the end point of the line
        const length = item.hours * $.config.scaleFactor[0];
        const x2 = centerX + ($.config.circleRadius + length) * Math.cos(angle);
        const y2 = centerY + ($.config.circleRadius + length) * Math.sin(angle);

        const angleDegrees = angleStep * index;
        let textTransform = `rotate(${angleDegrees} ${x2} ${y2})`;

        // Adjust rotation to ensure text reads correctly
        if (angleDegrees < -90 || angleDegrees > 90) {
          textTransform += ` rotate(180 ${x2 + 5} ${y2 - 15})`;
        }

        return {
          ...item,
          x1,
          y1,
          x2,
          y2,
          textTransform,
        };
      });
    }
  </script>
  <script type="config">
    {
      circleRadius: 50, // Radius of the center circle
      scaleFactor: [1.8], // Factor to scale hours to length
    }
  </script>
</g-composer>

title: 3 value circles graph
description: A visual representation of activity types with circles representing hours spent. Female contributions are marked with a white center circle.
code:
<g-composer>
  <template>
    <svg viewBox="0 0 500 500" width="500" height="500" font-size="14">
      <g g-for="(info, n) of data">
        <text
          style="font-family: Helvetica, Verdana, sans-serif; fill:#333333"
          g-content="info.text"
          x="2"
          g-bind:y="(56 * n) + 26"
        ></text>
        <g g-for="(circleIndex, i) of Array.from({ length: Math.ceil(info.hours / 3) })">
          <circle
            g-bind:cx="8 + (i * 20)"
            g-bind:cy="(56 * n) + 40"
            r="6"
            g-bind:stroke="info.color"
            stroke-width="4"
            g-bind:fill="i < Math.ceil(info.hours / 3 * (info.female / info.hours)) ? 'white' : info.color"
          ></circle>
        </g>
      </g>
    </svg>
  </template>
  <script type="data">
    [
      {
        text: "Social networks",
        hours: 75,
        female: 32,
        male: 43,
        color: "#007EA7",
      },
      { text: "Messaging", hours: 45, female: 25, male: 20, color: "#FFE066" },
      { text: "Games", hours: 36, female: 12, male: 24, color: "#414288" },
      { text: "Calls", hours: 22, female: 11, male: 11, color: "#F25F5C" },
      {
        text: "Internet browsing",
        hours: 54,
        female: 23,
        male: 31,
        color: "#6CAE75",
      },
      {
        text: "Other applications",
        hours: 26,
        female: 10,
        male: 16,
        color: "#E86A92",
      },
    ]
  </script>
</g-composer>

title: Lollipop Chart
description:
Lollipop charts work as a clean and simple visualization for some data sets. 

In this example, we show how to calculate the size of each of the lollipops based on the highest value in the data.
code:
<g-composer>
  <template>
    <svg :viewBox="[0, 0, data.length * 10, 140]" :width="data.length * 30">
      <g g-for="({name, value}, n) of data">
        <g :transform="$$.translate(n * 10, 0)">
          <line x1="4" x2="4" y1="94" :y2="94 - (80 * (value / data.$max('value')))" stroke="red"></line>
          <circle r="2.5" cx="4" :cy="94 - (80 * (value / data.$max('value')))" fill="red" stroke-width="1" stroke="white" ></circle>
          <text x="4" :y="90 - (80 * (value / data.$max('value')))" g-content="value" text-anchor="middle" font-family="sans-serif" font-size="5"></text>
          <text transform="rotate(-90)" transform-origin="6 100" x="8" y="100" g-content="name" text-anchor="end" font-family="sans-serif" font-size="5" ></text>
        </g>
      </g>
    </svg>
  </template>
  <script type="data">
    name,value
    "Edan Goff",158
    "Isabelle Mathews",70
    "Calista Barnett",162
    "Karina Paul",110
    "Sydnee Paul",18
    "Price Mcmillan",33
    "Hadassah Love",125
    "Jasmine Talley",18
    "Chaney Strong",111
    "Amena Pratt",100
  </script>
</g-composer>

title: Performace bar
description: Overlay bar chart with rounded corners showing current and target values.
code:
<g-composer>
  <template>
    <svg :viewBox="[0, 0, 155, (data.length * 12) + 20]" width="400" font-family="sans-serif">
      <g g-for="({label, current, currentValue, target, targetValue}, n) of data" >
        <g :transform="$$.translate(50, n * 12)">
          <text x="-5" y="12" text-anchor="end" font-size="5"
            g-content="label"></text>
          <line x1="0" :x2="target" y1="10" y2="10" 
            stroke-width="5" stroke="orange" stroke-linecap="round"/>
          <line x1="0" :x2="current" y1="10" y2="10" 
            stroke-width="5" stroke="green" stroke-linecap="round"/>
          <circle cy="10" :cx="current" r="4" fill="white" stroke="black" stroke-width="0.1"></circle>
          <text y="10.5" :x="current" dominant-baseline="middle" text-anchor="middle" font-size="3.5"
            g-content="currentValue"></text>
          <circle cy="10" :cx="target" r="4" fill="white" stroke="black" stroke-width="0.1"></circle>
          <text y="10.5" :x="target" dominant-baseline="middle" text-anchor="middle" font-size="3.5"
            g-content="targetValue"></text>
        </g>
      </g>
      <g :transform="$$.translate(data[data.length - 1].target + 42, (data.length * 12) + 2)">
        <line x1="8" x2="8" y1="0" y2="6" stroke="black" stroke-width="0.3"/>
        <rect x="0" y="6" width="16" height="8" rx="5" ry="5" stroke="black" stroke-width="0.2" fill="white"></rect>
        <text x="8" y="10.3" dominant-baseline="middle" text-anchor="middle" font-size="3.5">target</text>
      </g>
      <g :transform="$$.translate(data[data.length - 1].current + 42, (data.length * 12) + 2)">
        <line x1="8" x2="8" y1="0" y2="6" stroke="black" stroke-width="0.3"/>
        <rect x="0" y="6" width="16" height="8" rx="5" ry="5" stroke="black" stroke-width="0.2" fill="white"></rect>
        <text x="8" y="10.3" dominant-baseline="middle" text-anchor="middle" font-size="3.5">current</text>
      </g>
    </svg>
  </template>
  <script type="data">
    "country","current","target"
    "Germany",313,427
    "France",246,611
    "United Kingdom",191,546
    "Indonesia",183,656
    "Australia",345,514
    "South Korea",446,792
    "Mexico",558,687
    "Brazil",437,533
    "Argentina",481,695
  </script>
  <script type="methods">
    function data(originalData) {
      let max = 0;
      for (let r of originalData) {
        if (r.current > max) {
          max = r.current;
        }
        if (r.target > max) {
          max = r.target;
        }
      }
      const values = originalData.map(r => ({
        label: r.country,
        current: r.current / max * 100,
        currentValue: r.current,
        target: r.target / max * 100,
        targetValue: r.target,
      }));
      return values;
    }
  </script>
</g-composer>

title: Spiral chart
description: The visualization showing a spiral chart of medal counts from top countries in the 2024 Olympics Games.
code:
<g-composer>
  <template>
    <svg :viewBox="[0, 0, 200, data.height]" :height="data.height * 2.5" style="background-color: white" font-family="sans-serif">
      <g g-for="(record, i) of data">
        <text font-size="6"
              :x="i % 2 ? 87 : 113" 
              :y="record.y + 3"
              :text-anchor="i % 2 ? 'end' : 'start'"
              g-content="record.label" ></text>
        <g g-for="x of record.n">
          <line x1="100" stroke="black" stroke-width="0.1"
                :y1="record.y"
                :x2="$.polar2cartesian(100, record.y, record.r, x / record.n * 180 * (i % 2 ? 1 : -1)).x" 
                :y2="$.polar2cartesian(100, record.y, record.r, x / record.n * 180).y"/>
          <circle r="2" stroke-width="0.3"
                  :cx="$.polar2cartesian(100, record.y, record.r, x / record.n * 180 * (i % 2 ? 1 : -1)).x" 
                  :cy="$.polar2cartesian(100, record.y, record.r, x / record.n * 180).y" 
                  :fill="x < record.g ? '#ffd700' : x < record.g + record.s ? '#ddd' : '#b8860b'"/>
          <text g-if="x + 1 === record.g || x + 1 === record.g + record.s || x + 1 === record.g + record.s + record.b"
                :x="$.polar2cartesian(100, record.y + 1, record.r + 5, x / record.n * 180 * (i % 2 ? 1 : -1)).x" 
                :y="$.polar2cartesian(100, record.y + 1, record.r + 5, x / record.n * 180).y"
                :text-anchor="i % 2 ? 'start' : 'end'"
                font-size="4"
                g-content="x < record.g ? record.gold : x < record.g + record.s ? record.silver : record.bronze"> 
            x
          </text>
        </g>
        <clipPath :id="'clip-circle-' + i"><circle cx="100" :cy="record.y" r="10"/></clipPath>
        <image x="86.5" width="27"
               :y="record.y - 10" 
               :clip-path="`url(#clip-circle-${i})`"
               :href="record.image"/>
      </g>
    </svg>
  </template>
  <script type="data">
    country,code,gold,silver,bronze,total
    "United States of America","us",40,44,42,126
    "People's Republic of China","cn",40,27,24,91
    "Great Britain","gb",14,22,29,65
    "France","fr",16,26,22,64
    "Australia","au",18,19,16,53
  </script>
  <script type="methods">
    function data (originData) {
      const result = [];
      let y = 10;
      let r = 0;
      for (const country of originData) {
        y += r + (country.total / 2);
        r = country.total / 2;
        result.push({
          label: `${country.country} (${country.total})`,
          image: `https://flagicons.lipis.dev/flags/4x3/${country.code}.svg`,
          y,
          r,
          n: 0 | country.total / 3,
          g: 0 | country.gold / 3,
          s: 0 | country.silver / 3,
          b: 0 | country.bronze / 3,
          gold: country.gold,
          silver: country.silver,
          bronze: country.bronze
        })
      }
      result.height = y + r + 10;
      return result;
    }
  </script>
  <script type="plugin" src="https://cdn.graphery.online/graphane/1.0.0-beta/plugins/shapes.js"></script>
</g-composer>

title: Temperature Radial Chart
description: Radial temperature graph showing minimum and maximum values throughout the year.
code:
<g-composer id="example">
  <template>
    <svg viewBox="0 0 1000 1000" width="300" height="300">
      <g g-for="(t, n) of [-15,-10,-5,0,5,10,15,20,25,30,35,40,45,50]">
        <circle
          cx="500"
          cy="500"
          stroke="black"
          stroke-width="1"
          fill="none"
          g-bind:r="(n + 1) * 490 / 15"
        ></circle>
      </g>
      <g
        g-for="m of [30.58, 58.19, 88.77, 118.36, 148.93, 178.52, 209.10, 239.67, 269.26, 299.84, 329.42, 360.00]"
      >
        <line
          stroke="black"
          stroke-width="1"
          x1="500"
          y1="500"
          g-bind:x2="$.polar2cartesian(500,500,460, m).x"
          g-bind:y2="$.polar2cartesian(500,500,460, m).y"
        ></line>
      </g>
      <path
        id="max"
        stroke="red"
        stroke-width="2"
        fill="none"
        g-bind:d="draw($$, 'max')"
      ></path>
      <path
        id="min"
        stroke="blue"
        stroke-width="2"
        fill="none"
        g-bind:d="draw($$, 'min')"
      ></path>
      <path
        fill="rgba(128,128,128,0.3)"
        fill-rule="evenodd"
        g-bind:d="$.svg.querySelector('#max').d() + $.svg.querySelector('#min').d()"
      ></path>
    </svg>
  </template>
  <script type="data" src="https://cdn.graphery.online/graphane/examples/data/temp.csv"></script> 
  <script type="methods">
    const day = 360 / 365;
    const g = 460 / 65;
    function draw(d, key) {
      for (let n = 0; n != $.data.length; n++) {
        const p = $.polar2cartesian(500, 500, ($.data[n][key] + 15) * g, day * n);
        if (n === 0) {
          d.M(p.x, p.y);
        } else {
          d.L(p.x, p.y);
        }
      }
      d.z();
    }
  </script>
  <script
    type="plugin"
    src="https://cdn.graphery.online/graphane/1.0.0-beta/plugins/shapes.js"
  ></script>
</g-composer>

<g-composer style="width: 100%">
  <template>
    <svg g-bind:viewbox="`0 0 ${(data.length) * 170 + 30} 500`" font-family="sans-serif" >
      <g g-for="(value, idx) of data">
        <g g-bind:transform="$$.translate(idx * 170)">
          <circle cx="100" cy="250" r="60"
            g-bind:style="{fill: value.color}"/>
          <text x="100" y="250" text-anchor="middle" dominant-baseline="middle"
            g-content="value.key"
            style="font-size: 42px; fill: white;"></text>
          <g g-if="!(idx % 2)">
            <path d="M0,165L0,0L200,0L200,165C140,100,60,100,0,165Z"
              style="fill: rgb(241, 241, 241);"/>
            <path d="M200,250A100,100,0,0,0,0,250L30,250A70,70,0,0,1,170,250Z"
              g-bind:style="{fill: value.color}"/>
            <text x="100" y="60" text-anchor="middle"
              g-content="value.title"
              style="font-size: 26px; fill: rgb(0, 0, 0);"></text>
            <text x="100" y="84" text-anchor="middle"
              g-content="value.subtitle"
              style="font-size: 16px; fill: rgb(0, 0, 0);"></text>
          </g>
          <g g-if="idx % 2">
            <path d="M0,335L0,500L200,500L200,335C140,400,60,400,0,335Z"
              style="fill: rgb(241, 241, 241);"/>
            <path d="M0,250A100,100,0,0,0,200,250L170,250A70,70,0,0,1,30,250Z"
              g-bind:style="{fill: value.color}"/>
            <text x="100" y="430" text-anchor="middle"
              g-content="value.title"
              style="font-size: 26px; fill: rgb(0, 0, 0);"></text>
            <text x="100" y="454" text-anchor="middle" 
              g-content="value.subtitle"
              style="font-size: 16px; fill: rgb(0, 0, 0);"
            ></text>
          </g>
        </g>
      </g>
    </svg>
  </template>
  <script type="data">
    "key";"title";"subtitle";"color"
    "01";"Analysis";"understand the problem";"#515AA8"
    "02";"Alternatives";"describe solutions";"#08909F"
    "03";"Decision";"select the best";"#13A0C0"
    "04";"Implement";"run the project";"#41BB95"
    "05";"Evaluate";"measure the result";"#89C540"
  </script>
</g-composer>

title: Votes
description: Simple vote distribution
code:
<g-composer style="width: 400px">
  <template>
    <svg :viewBox="$.config.viewBox">         <!-- Bind the SVG viewBox to dynamically adjust its size -->
      <g g-for="(r, i) of data">           <!-- Loop through the data array and create circles -->
        <circle g-bind:cx="Math.floor(i / $.config.n) * $.config.m + $.config.m"  
                g-bind:cy="Math.floor(i % $.config.n) * $.config.m + $.config.m"  
                g-bind:fill="r.color"                                             
                g-bind:r="$.config.r">        <!-- Circle for each element -->
          <title g-content="r.label"></title> <!-- Tooltip that displays the label for each circle -->
        </circle>
      </g>
    </svg>
  </template>
  <!-- Data in JSON format containing groups and their votes -->
  <script type="data">[
    {group: 'A', votes: 446},
    {group: 'B', votes: 325},
    {group: 'C', votes: 73}
  ]</script>
  
  <script type="methods">
    // Configure the SVG viewBox dimensions based on the number of circles n) and margin (m)
    $.config.viewBox = [
      0,
      0,
      $.config.n * $.config.m + $.config.m, // Width of the viewBox
      $.config.n * $.config.m + $.config.m  // Height of the viewBox
    ];

    // Percentage formater
    const formater =  new Intl.NumberFormat("en-US", {
      style: 'percent',
      minimumFractionDigits: 2,
      maximumFractionDigits: 2
    });

    // Data function to compute the nodes to be displayed in the SVG
    function data(source) {
      
      // Total number of nodes (n x n grid)
      const total_nodes = $.config.n * $.config.n;  
      
      // Calculate the total votes 
      const total = source.reduce((n, r) => {      
        return n + r.votes
      }, 0);
      
      // Calculate percentage of nodes for each group based on votes
      const distribution = source.map((r, i) => {
        return {
          ...r, 
          percentage: r.votes / total, // Calculate the percentage of total nodes
          color: $.config.pallete[i]   // Assign a color from the palette
        };
      });

      // Generate an array of nodes with labels and colors
      const nodes = distribution.map((r, i) => {
        return Array(Math.floor(r.percentage * total_nodes)).fill({
          // Label each node with group, votes, and percentage
          label: `${ r.group } - ${r.votes} votes (${ formater.format(r.percentage) })`, 
          // Assign color from pallete
          color: $.config.pallete[i]
        });
      }).flat(); /* Flatten the array */

      // If there are not enough nodes, duplicate the last node to fill the grid
      while (nodes.length < total_nodes) {
        nodes.push(nodes[nodes.length - 1]); // Add extra nodes with the same properties as the last one
      }
      
      return nodes; // Return the array of nodes
    }
  </script>
  <script type="config">
    // Configuration for the grid and appearance of circles
    { 
      n: 20,                            /* Number of rows/columns in the grid (n x n) */
      r: 5,                             /* Radius of each circle */
      m: 20,                            /* Margin between circles */
      pallete: ['#ed254e', '#3f84e5', '#3f784c', '#c17817', '#f0e2e7'] /* Color palette for the circles */
    }
  </script>
</g-composer>
