title: Wind Turbine Installation by Countries
description: This graphic represents wind energy production across bigger countries, each illustrated with a rotating wind turbine. The turbines spin at a speed proportional to the amount of wind energy produced by the respective country, with faster rotations representing higher energy outputs.
code:
<g-composer style="width: 100%">
  <template>
    <svg version="1.1" :viewBox="[0, 0, 512 * ((data.length / 3) + 1), 600 * ((data.length / 3))]">
      <g g-for="({wind, country}, n) of data">
        <g :transform="$$.translate((n % 3) * 512, Math.floor(n / 3) * 600)">
          <path fill="#555" d="M256,233c-12.8,0-23,10.2-23,23s10.2,23,23,23,23-10.2,23-23-10.2-23-23-23Z"/>
          <path fill="#555" d="M272.8,293.4c-5.1,2.3-10.8,3.6-16.8,3.6s-11.6-1.3-16.8-3.6l-7.2,202.6h48l-7.2-202.6h0Z"/>
          <g fill="#444">
            <path d="M272,16c-32,48-39,116-38,176,.1,7.3,2.5,17.5,5.1,26.7,5.2-2.4,10.9-3.7,16.9-3.7s6,.3,8.9,1l7.1-200Z"/>
            <path d="M296.8,260c-.9,9.1-4.8,17.3-10.6,23.6l169.6,106.2c-25.6-51.7-81-91.7-133.4-120.9-6.4-3.5-16.4-6.6-25.6-8.9h0Z"/>
            <path d="M216.9,268.3l-176.8,93.8c57.6,3.7,119.9-24.2,171.4-55.1,6.3-3.8,13.9-10.9,20.6-17.8-7.1-5.1-12.5-12.4-15.2-21h0Z"/>
            <animateTransform
              attributeName="transform"
              attributeType="XML"
              type="rotate"
              from="0 256 256"
              to="360 256 256"
              :dur="`${ 0.5 / (wind / data.$max('wind')) }s`"
              repeatCount="indefinite" 
            />
          </g>
          <text x="256" y="540" dominant-baseline="middle" text-anchor="middle" font-family="sans-serif" font-size="30"
                g-content="country"></text>
          <text x="256" y="580" dominant-baseline="middle" text-anchor="middle" font-family="sans-serif" font-size="20">
            (<tspan g-content="new Intl.NumberFormat().format(wind)"></tspan> MW)
          </text>
        </g>
      </g>
    </svg>
  </template>

</g-composer>

title: Spiral Value Indicator
description: This graph shows a spiral path with a circle that moves along the spiral according to the value of the data (which ranges from 0 to 100).
code:
<g-composer data="value: 50">
  <template>
    <svg viewBox="0 0 400 400" @render="load">
      <path 
        id="route"
        :d="$.methods.generateSpiralCurve(200, 200, 10, 100, -90, (360 * 3) + 90)" 
        stroke-width="3" 
        stroke="green" 
        fill="none"/>
      <circle 
        id="point"
        cx="-10" 
        cy="-10" 
        r="10" 
        fill="green"></circle>
    </svg>
  </template>
  <script type="methods"> 
    const round = (n) => Math.round(n * 10000) / 10000;
    function load() {
      const path = $.svg.querySelector('#route');
      const circle = $.svg.querySelector('#point');
      const totalLength = path.getTotalLength(); 
      const position = path.getPointAtLength(round($.data.value / 100 * totalLength));
      circle.cx(position.x).cy(position.y); 
    }
    function degrees2radians (degrees) {
      return ((degrees - 90) * Math.PI) / 180;
    }
    function radians2cartesian (cx, cy, r, angleRadians) {
      return {
        x : round(cx + r * Math.cos(angleRadians)),
        y : round(cy + r * Math.sin(angleRadians))
      };
    }
    function polar2cartesian (cx, cy, r, angleDegrees) {
      const angleRadians = degrees2radians(angleDegrees);
      return radians2cartesian (cx, cy, r, angleRadians);
    }
    function generateSpiralCurve(cx, cy, initial_radius, final_radius, start_degrees, end_degrees, step_size = 10) {
      step_size = step_size > 10 ? 10 : step_size  < 1 ? 1 : step_size ;
      const steps = (end_degrees - start_degrees) / step_size ; // Define the number of steps to smooth the spiral
      const deltaRadius = (final_radius - initial_radius) / steps; // Increment of the radius per step
  
      // Convert start and end degrees to radians
      const initialTheta = degrees2radians(start_degrees);
      const finalTheta = degrees2radians(end_degrees);
  
      // Angular increment per step
      const deltaTheta = (finalTheta - initialTheta) / steps;
  
      // Initial coordinates
      const {x: initial_x, y: initial_y} = polar2cartesian(cx, cy, initial_radius, start_degrees);
      let d = `M ${initial_x},${initial_y} `; // Move the cursor to the starting point
  
      for (let i = 1; i <= steps; i++) {
          // Current radius (interpolating between initial_radius and final_radius)
          const radius = initial_radius + i * deltaRadius;
  
          // Current angle
          const theta = initialTheta + i * deltaTheta;
  
          // Current x and y coordinates of the point in the spiral
          const {x, y} = radians2cartesian(cx, cy, radius, theta);
  
          // Control points for the cubic curves
          const control_radius1 = initial_radius + (i - 0.33) * deltaRadius; // Control point 1 at one-third of the step
          const control_theta1 = initialTheta + (i - 0.33) * deltaTheta;     // Angle at the first control point
          const {x: control_x1, y: control_y1} = radians2cartesian(cx, cy, control_radius1, control_theta1);
  
          const control_radius2 = initial_radius + (i - 0.66) * deltaRadius; // Control point 2 at two-thirds of the step
          const control_theta2 = initialTheta + (i - 0.66) * deltaTheta;     // Angle at the second control point
          const {x: control_x2, y: control_y2} = radians2cartesian(cx, cy, control_radius2, control_theta2);
  
          // Generate the cubic curve command (C)
          d += `C ${control_x1},${control_y1} ${control_x2},${control_y2} ${x},${y} `;
      }
  
      return d;
    }
  </script>
</g-composer>
<input type="range" value="50" min="0" max="100" oninput="document.querySelector('g-composer').data.value = Number(this.value)">

title: Pyramid
description: This is the pyramid that summarizes the Spanish population, last measured in the year 2023.
code:
<g-composer>
  <template>
    <svg viewBox="0 0 600 650" width="600" height="650" font-size="12">
      <g g-for="(group, index) of data">
        <text
          :y="(30 * index) + 25"
          x="290"
          style="font-family: Helvetica, Verdana, sans-serif; fill: #333"
          g-content="group.age"
          text-anchor="middle"
        ></text>
        <g style="font-family: Helvetica, Verdana, sans-serif; fill: white">
          <!-- Bars for the male population -->
          <rect
            :x="270 - group.men / 10000"
            :y="(30 * index) + 10"
            :width="group.men / 10000" 
            height="20"
            fill="#007EA7"
          ></rect>
          <text
            :x="320 - (group.men / 10000)"
            :y="(30 * index) + 25"
            g-content="group.men"
            text-anchor="end"
          ></text>  
          <!-- Bars for the female population -->
          <rect
            :y="(30 * index) + 10"
            :width="group.women / 10000" 
            x="310"
            height="20"
            fill="#D7263D"
          ></rect>
          <text
            :x="260 + (group.women / 10000)"
            :y="(30 * index) + 25"          
            g-content="group.women"
            text-anchor="start"
          ></text>
        </g>
      </g>
      <g style="font-family: Helvetica, Verdana, sans-serif; fill: #333">
        <g g-for="n of 23">

title: Colombian piramid
description: This is the pyramid that summarizes the Spanish population, last measured in the year 2023.
code:
<g-composer>
  <template>
    <svg viewBox="0 0 600 750" width="600" height="750" font-size="12">
      <g g-for="(group, index) of data">
        <text
          :y="(30 * index) + 25"
          x="290"
          style="font-family: Helvetica, Verdana, sans-serif; fill: #333"
          g-content="group.age"
          text-anchor="middle"
        ></text>
        <g style="font-family: Helvetica, Verdana, sans-serif; fill: white">
          <!-- Bars for the male population -->
          <rect
            :x="270 - group.men / 10000"
            :y="(30 * index) + 10"
            :width="group.men / 10000" 
            height="20"
            fill="#007EA7"
          ></rect>
          <text
            :x="320 - (group.men / 10000)"
            :y="(30 * index) + 25"
            g-content="group.men"
            text-anchor="end"
          ></text>  
          <!-- Bars for the female population -->
          <rect
            :y="(30 * index) + 10"
            :width="group.women / 10000" 
            x="310"
            height="20"
            fill="#D7263D"
          ></rect>
          <text
            :x="260 + (group.women / 10000)"
            :y="(30 * index) + 25"          
            g-content="group.women"
            text-anchor="start"
          ></text>
        </g>
      </g>
      <g style="font-family: Helvetica, Verdana, sans-serif; fill: #333;" transform="translate(0, 90)">
        <g g-for="n of 23">
          <line :x1="76 + (n * 19.5)" y1="555" :x2="76 + (n * 19.5)" y2="550" stroke="#333" stroke-width="1"></line>
        </g>    
        
        <line x1="50" y1="555" x2="530" y2="555" stroke="#333" stroke-width="1"></line>
        <text x="293" y="570" text-anchor="end" style="fill: #333">0</text>
        <text x="515" y="570" text-anchor="end" style="fill: #333">2M</text>
        <text x="85" y="570" text-anchor="end" style="fill: #333">2M</text>
               
        <text x="90" y="590" style="fill: #007EA7; font-size: 14; font-weight: bold;"g-content="'Total Hombres: ' + Intl.NumberFormat('es-ES').format(data.$sum('men')) "></text>
        <text x="310" y="590" style="fill: #D7263D; font-size: 14; font-weight: bold;" text-anchor="start" g-content="'Total Mujeres: ' + Intl.NumberFormat('es-ES').format(data.$sum('women'))"></text>
        <text x="290" y="620" style="fill: #333; font-size: 16; font-weight: bold;" text-anchor="middle" g-content="'Total Población: ' + Intl.NumberFormat('es-ES').format(data.$sum('women') + data.$sum('men')) "></text>
      </g>
    </svg>
  </template>

title: Line chart curve
description: It is a line chart with shading, composed of months and numbers.
code:
<g-composer id="line-chart">
  <template>
    <svg
      viewBox="0 0 700 200"
      width="700"
      height="200"
      style="font-family:'Arial'; font-size: 11px;"
    >
      <!-- area sombreada debajo de la línea -->
      <path
        :d="competeData(data, 39, 160, 560, 150, true)"
        fill="rgba(0, 200, 150, 0.2)"
        stroke="none"
      ></path>
      
      <!-- Línea de datos -->
      <path
        :d="competeData(data, 39, 160, 560, 150)"
        fill="none"
        stroke="rgb(0, 200, 150)"
        stroke-width="3"
      ></path>

      <g g-for="n of 7">
        <text
          :y="(n * 25) + 14"
          x="10"
          fill="#4d4d4d"
          g-content="Math.round(Math.ceil(data.$max() / 10) * 10 / 6 * (6 - n))"
        ></text>
        <line
          :y1="(n * 25) + 10"
          :y2="(n * 25) + 10"
          x1="40"
          x2="600"
          stroke="#a5a5a5"
          stroke-width="0.5"
        ></line>
      </g>
      
      <g g-for="(v, n) of 12">
        <text
          :x="(n * 50) + 35"
          y="180"
          fill="#4d4d4d"
          g-content="$.config.month[n]"
        ></text>        
      </g>
    </svg>
  </template>
  
  <!-- Script para generar la curva suavizada -->
  <script type="methods">
    function competeData(data, xStart, yStart, width, height, fillArea = false) {
      const step = width / (data.length - 1);
      let d = fillArea ? `M${xStart},${yStart}` : `M${xStart},${yStart - ((data[0] / (Math.ceil(data.$max() / 10) * 10)) * height)}`;

      for (let i = 0; i < data.length - 1; i++) {
        const x0 = (i * step) + xStart;
        const x1 = ((i + 1) * step) + xStart;
        const y0 = yStart - ((data[i] / (Math.ceil(data.$max() / 10) * 10)) * height);
        const y1 = yStart - ((data[i + 1] / (Math.ceil(data.$max() / 10) * 10)) * height);

        const cp1x = x0 + step / 2;
        const cp1y = y0;
        const cp2x = x1 - step / 2;
        const cp2y = y1;

        d += ` C${cp1x},${cp1y} ${cp2x},${cp2y} ${x1},${y1}`;
      }

      if (fillArea) {
        d += ` L${xStart + (step * (data.length - 1))},${yStart} L${xStart},${yStart} Z`;
      }

      return d;
    }
  </script>
  
  <script type="data">
    [
      6, 7, 2, 14, 8, 3, 19, 18, 11, 15, 21, 20, 2, 22, 10, 1, 9, 13, 24, 12, 17,
      16, 4, 5,
    ]
  </script>
  
  <script type="config">
    {
      month: ['ENE','FEB','MAR','ABR','MAY','JUN','JUL','AGO','SEP','OCT','NOV','DIC']
    }
  </script>
</g-composer>

title: Fall alert
description:
Animated and dynamic icon representing a person's fall alert, with two different illustrations that toggle based on the data.

When the data value is true, the red path is shown with a person falling or in an emergency posture.

When the data value is false, the black path is displayed with a person standing still.

  <template>

      <polygon :points="right" fill="red"></polygon>
      <text x="0" y="52" font-family="sans-serif" font-size="6">left-handler</text>
      <text x="66" y="52" font-family="sans-serif" font-size="6">right-handler</text>
    </svg>
  </template>
  <script type="methods">
    function data(origin) {
      const l = 100 * origin;
      const r = 100 * (1 - origin);
      return {
        left:  [50,(50 - l / 2), 50,(l / 2 + 50), (50 - l / 2),50],
        right: [50,(50 - r / 2), 50,(r / 2 + 50), (50 + r / 2),50]
      }
    }
  </script>
</g-composer>

title: Man or Woman
description: It generates an interactive image split into two halves
code:
<g-composer value="0.5">
  <template>
    <svg viewBox="0 0 100 100" 
         @mousemove="drag" 
         @touchmove="touchMove" 
         @click="position">
      <image x="0" y="0" height="100" 
             preserveAspectRatio="xMinYMin slice" 
             href="https://cdn.graphery.online/graphane/examples/img/persons.webp"
            :width="100 * value"/>
      <image y="0" height="100" 
             preserveAspectRatio="xMaxYMin slice" 
             href="https://cdn.graphery.online/graphane/examples/img/persons.webp"
             :x="100 * value" 
             :width="100 * (1- value)"/>
        <line y1="0" y2="100" stroke-width="1" stroke="black" style="cursor:w-resize"
             :x1="100 * value" 
             :x2="100 * value" 
             @mousedown="startDrag" 
             @mouseup="stopDrag"/> 
    </svg>
  </template>
  <script type="methods">
    let dragging = false;
    function startDrag() {
      dragging = true;
    }
    function stopDrag() {
      dragging = false;
    }
    function drag(e) {
      if (dragging) {
        $.value = e.offsetX / $.svg.width.baseVal.value();
      }
    }
    function position(e) {
      $.value = e.offsetX / $.svg.width.baseVal.value();
    }
    function touchMove(e) {
      e.preventDefault();
      $.value = e.touches[0].clientX / $.svg.width.baseVal.value();
    }
  </script>
</g-composer>

title: Radial Bar Visualization
description: This graphic is a radial chart representing individual scores. Each segment of the circle corresponds to one person. The opacity and stroke width are determined by each individual's score, creating a visual distinction between higher and lower values.
code:
<g-composer>
  <template>
    <svg viewBox="0 0 1000 1000" width="400">
      <g g-for="(d, i) of data">
        <g g-for="n of 10">
          <path stroke-linecap="round"
                fill="none"
                :stroke="$.config.pallete[i]"
                :opacity="(n / 10) + 0.2"
                :d="$$.arc( 500, 500, 400 / 10 * (n + 1), 360 / data.length - 10, 360 / data.length * i)" 
                :stroke-width="d.value / 10 < (n + 1) ? 1 : 25"></path>
        </g>
        <text font-family="sans-serif"
              font-size="35"
              text-anchor="middle"
              dominant-baseline="middle"
              :x="$.polar2cartesian(500, 500, 460, 360 / data.length * (i + 0.5)).x"
              :y="$.polar2cartesian(500, 500, 460, 360 / data.length * (i + 0.5)).y"
              g-content="d.label"></text>
      </g>
    </svg>
  </template>
  <script type="data">
    label;value
    Alice;70
    Blake;80
    Chloe;80
    Dylan;50
    Emily;90
    Frank;40
    Grace;60
  </script>
  <script type="config">
    {
      pallete: [
        '#1f77b4', 
        '#ff7f0e', 
        '#2ca02c', 
        '#d62728', 
        '#9467bd', 
        '#8c564b', 
        '#e377c2', 
        '#7f7f7f', 
        '#bcbd22', 
        '#17becf']
    }
  </script>
  <script type="plugin" src="https://cdn.graphery.online/graphane/1.0.0-beta/plugins/shapes.js"></script>
</g-composer>

  <template>
  <svg width="200" height="200" xmlns="http://www.w3.org/2000/svg" viewBox="0 0 200 200">
    <g transform="scale(1,1)">
      <!-- Draw top face -->
      <polygon points="50,30 150,30 170,50 70,50" fill="#FFCC00" />
      <!-- Draw left face -->
      <polygon points="50,30 70,50 70,150 50,130" fill="#FF9900" />
      <!-- Draw front face -->
      <polygon points="70,50 170,50 170,150 70,150" fill="#FF3300" />  </svg>
    </g>
  </template>
  <script type="data">
  </script>
</g-composer>

title: Rainfall Distribution
description: This graph illustrates the daily rainfall in Buxells throughout 2023. The graph is structured as a grid, with months displayed horizontally and days listed vertically. Each circle represents a rainfall event, with its size proportional to the recorded amount of precipitation for that day.

title: 1th chat gpt graph
code:
<g-composer id="line-chart">
  <template>
    <svg width="500" height="300">
      <line x1="0" y1="250" x2="500" y2="250" stroke="black" />
      <line x1="50" y1="0" x2="50" y2="250" stroke="black" />
      <polyline
        fill="none"
        stroke="blue"
        stroke-width="2"
        g-bind:points="linePoints()"
      />
      <g g-for="(point, index) of data.data">
        <circle 
          r="3" 
          stroke="blue" 
          fill="white" 
          g-bind:cx="50 + index * spacing" 
          g-bind:cy="250 - point.value * yScale" 
        />
        <text 
          g-bind:x="50 + index * spacing" 
          g-bind:y="260" 
          font-size="10" 
          text-anchor="middle"
          g-content="point.label"
        ></text>
      </g>
    </svg>
  </template>

  <script type="data">
    {
      "data": [
        {"label": "Jan", "value": 10},
        {"label": "Feb", "value": 20},
        {"label": "Mar", "value": 15},
        {"label": "Apr", "value": 30},
        {"label": "May", "value": 25}
      ],
      "spacing": 100,
      "yScale": 5
    }
  </script>

  <script type="methods">
    function linePoints() {
      return $.data.data.map((point, index) => {
        const x = 50 + index * $.data.spacing;
        const y = 250 - point.value * $.data.yScale;
        return `${x},${y}`;
      }).join(' ');
    }
  </script>
</g-composer>

title: 2nd chat gpt graph
code:
<g-composer id="curve-line-chart">
  <template>
    <svg viewBox="0 0 200 100" width="200" height="100">
      <g stroke="blue" stroke-width="2" fill="none">
        <path
          g-bind:d="ready()"
        ></path>
      </g>
      <g g-for="point of data">
        <circle :cx="point.x" :cy="point.y" r="4" fill="red"></circle>
      </g>
    </svg>
  </template>
  <script type="data">
    [
        { x: 10, y: 90 },
        { x: 50, y: 40 },
        { x: 90, y: 70 },
        { x: 130, y: 30 },
        { x: 170, y: 70 },
    ]
  </script>
  <script type="methods">
    function interpolate(points) {
      if (points.length < 2) return '';

      const path = [];
      path.push(`M${points[0].x},${points[0].y}`);

      for (let i = 0; i < points.length - 1; i++) {
        const p0 = points[i];
        const p1 = points[i + 1];

        const cp1x = (p0.x + p1.x) / 2;
        const cp1y = p0.y;

        const cp2x = (p0.x + p1.x) / 2;
        const cp2y = p1.y;

        path.push(`C ${cp1x},${cp1y} ${cp2x},${cp2y} ${p1.x},${p1.y}`);
      }

      return path.join(' ');
    }

    function ready() {
      return interpolate($.data);
    }
  </script>
</g-composer>

title: Before and After Comparison
description:
Satellite images of Lake Tefé on August 26 2023 versus August 25 2024.

Copernicus, Sentinel-2 satellite
code:
<g-composer value="0.5">
  <template>
    <svg viewBox="0 0 960 540" 
         width="600"
         @mousemove="drag" 
         @touchmove="touchMove" 
         @click="position">
      <image x="0" y="0" height="540" 
             preserveAspectRatio="xMinYMin slice" 
             href="https://cdn.graphery.online/graphane/examples/img/before.webp"
             :width="960 * value"/>
      <image y="0" height="540" 
             preserveAspectRatio="xMaxYMin slice" 
             href="https://cdn.graphery.online/graphane/examples/img/after.webp"
             :x="960 * value" 
             :width="960 * (1- value)"/>
      <g @mousedown="startDrag" 
         @mouseup="stopDrag"
        style="cursor:w-resize">
        <line y1="0" y2="540" stroke-width="2" stroke="white" 
             :x1="960 * value" 
             :x2="960 * value"/> 
        <polygon :points="[(960 * value) - 4, 255, (960 * value) - 20, 270, (960 * value) - 4, 285]" fill="white"></polygon>
        <polygon :points="[(960 * value) + 4, 255, (960 * value) + 20, 270, (960 * value) + 4, 285]" fill="white"></polygon>
      </g>
      <text x="480" y="520" fill="white" text-anchor="middle">
        Satellite images of Lake Tefé on August 26 2023 versus August 25 2024 Copernicus, Sentinel-2 satellite
      </text>
    </svg>
  </template>
  <script type="methods">
    let dragging = false;
    function startDrag() {
      dragging = true;
    }
    function stopDrag() {
      dragging = false;
    }
    function drag(e) {
      if (dragging) {
        $.value = e.offsetX / $.svg.width.baseVal.value();
      }
    }
    function position(e) {
      $.value = e.offsetX / $.svg.width.baseVal.value();
    }
    function touchMove(e) {
      e.preventDefault();
      $.value = e.touches[0].clientX / $.svg.width.baseVal.value();
    }
  </script>
</g-composer>

<g-composer id="interactive-chart" style="width: 100%">
  <template>
    <svg :viewBox="[0, 0, 400, (data.length * 50) + 100]" font-family="sans-serif">
      <g g-for="(item, index) of data">
        <g :transform="$$.translate(50, index * 50)">
          <text x="0" y="15" g-content="item.label"></text>
          <rect x="100" y="0" :width="item.value" height="20" fill="blue"
                g-on:click="handleClick(index)">
          </rect>
          <text x="100" y="35" g-content="`Value: ${item.value}`"></text>
        </g>
      </g>
    </svg>
  </template>
  <script type="data">
    [
      { "label": "USA", "value": 100 },
      { "label": "China", "value": 150 },
      { "label": "India", "value": 80 }
    ]
  </script>
  <script type="methods">
    function data(originalData) {
      const max = Math.max(...originalData.map(c => c.value));
      return originalData.map(c => ({
        ...c,
        normalizedValue: c.value / max * 100
      }));
    }

    function handleClick(index) {
      // Función que maneja el evento click
      console.log(`Elemento ${index} clickeado`);
      // Ejemplo de actualización de datos
      $.data[index].value += 10;
    }
  </script>
</g-composer>

title: Sunburst
description: This graphic is a multi-level donut chart displaying categories and their corresponding subcategories. The outer ring represents the main categories, while the inner ring shows subcategories, each segment sized proportionally based on its percentage.
code:
<g-composer id="barArc">
  <template>
    <svg viewBox="0 0 500 500" width="500" height="500">
      <!-- Exterior -->
      <g g-for="(slice, n) of completeData(data)">
        <path
          stroke="#fff"
          stroke-width="2"
          g-bind:fill="slice.color"
          g-bind:d="$$.barArc(250, 250, 150, 50, slice.grades, slice.start)"
        ></path>
      </g>

      <g g-for="(slice, n) of completeInnerData(data)">
        <path
          stroke="#fff"
          stroke-width="2"
          g-bind:fill="slice.color"
          g-bind:d="$$.barArc(250, 250, 100, 50, slice.grades, slice.start)"
        ></path>
      </g>
      <g g-for="(slice, n) of data">
        <circle
          cx="350"
          g-bind:cy="(14*n)+50"
          r="4"
          g-bind:fill="slice.color"
        ></circle>
        <text
          style="font-family: Helvetica, Verdana, sans-serif; fill:#000"
          g-content="slice.name"
          x="360"
          g-bind:y="(14*n)+54"
          text-anchor="left"
          font-size="12"
        ></text>
      </g>
    </svg>
  </template>

  <script type="data">
    [
      {
        name: "Category 1",
        percentage: 20,
        color: "#6CAE75",
        subcategories: [
          { name: "Subcategory 1.1", percentage: 50, color: "#A1C084" },
          { name: "Subcategory 1.2", percentage: 50, color: "#B5D695" }
        ]
      },
      {
        name: "Category 2",
        percentage: 60,
        color: "#FFE066",
        subcategories: [
          { name: "Subcategory 2.1", percentage: 70, color: "#FFED99" },
          { name: "Subcategory 2.2", percentage: 30, color: "#FFF5B5" }
        ]
      },
      {
        name: "Category 3",
        percentage: 20,
        color: "#447A9C",
        subcategories: [
          { name: "Subcategory 3.1", percentage: 40, color: "#7FACC7" },
          { name: "Subcategory 3.2", percentage: 30, color: "#9CBED3" },
          { name: "Subcategory 3.3", percentage: 30, color: "#C7DAE6" }
        ]
      }
      
    ]
  </script>
  <script
    type="plugin"
    src="https://cdn.graphery.online/graphane/1.0.0-beta/plugins/shapes.js"
  ></script>
  <script type="methods">
    const centerX = 250;
    const centerY = 250;
    const outerRadius = 150;
    const outerThickness = 50;
    const innerRadius = 100;
    const innerThickness = 50;

    function completeData(data) {
      let startAngle = 0;
      return data.map((slice) => {
        const grades = (slice.percentage * 360) / 100;
        const pathData = {
          start: startAngle,
          grades,
          color: slice.color
        };
        startAngle += grades;
        return pathData;
      });
    }
 
    function completeInnerData(data) {
      let startAngle = 0;
      return data.flatMap((slice) => {
        const sliceAngle = (slice.percentage * 360) / 100;
        let innerStartAngle = startAngle;
        
        return slice.subcategories.map((subslice) => {
          const subGrades = (subslice.percentage * sliceAngle) / 100;
          const pathData = {
            start: innerStartAngle,
            grades: subGrades,
            color: subslice.color
          };
          startAngle += subGrades;
          innerStartAngle += subGrades;
          return pathData;
        });
      });
    }
  </script>
</g-composer>

          :transform="'rotate(' + (slice.label.angle + 90) + ',' + slice.label.x + ',' + slice.label.y + ')'" 
        ></text>
      </g>

      <g g-for="(slice, n) of completeInnerData(data)">
        <text
          :x="slice.label.x+20"
          :y="slice.label.y"
          fill="black"
          g-content="slice.name"
          text-anchor="middle"
          font-size="9pt"
          font-family="Arial"
          :transform="'rotate(' + (slice.label.angle + 90) + ',' + slice.label.x + ',' + slice.label.y + ')'"  
        ></text>
      </g>
    </svg>
  </template>
  <script type="data">
    [
      {
        name: "Category 1",
        percentage: 20,
        color: "#6CAE75",
        subcategories: [
          { name: "Subcategory 1.1", percentage: 50, color: "#A1C084" },
          { name: "Subcategory 1.2", percentage: 50, color: "#B5D695" },
        ],
      },
      {
        name: "Category 2",
        percentage: 60,
        color: "#FFE066",
        subcategories: [
          { name: "Subcategory 2.1", percentage: 70, color: "#FFED99" },
          { name: "Subcategory 2.2", percentage: 30, color: "#FFF5B5" },
        ],
      },
      {
        name: "Category 3",
        percentage: 20,
        color: "#447A9C",
        subcategories: [
          { name: "Subcategory 3.1", percentage: 40, color: "#7FACC7" },
          { name: "Subcategory 3.2", percentage: 30, color: "#9CBED3" },
          { name: "Subcategory 3.3", percentage: 30, color: "#C7DAE6" },
        ],
      },
    ]
  </script>
  <script type="methods">
    const centerX = 250;
    const centerY = 250;
    const outerRadius = 150;
    const outerThickness = 50;
    const innerRadius = 100;
    const innerThickness = 50;
    function completeData(data) {
  let startAngle = 0;
  const radius = outerRadius + outerThickness / 2;

  return data.map((slice) => {
    const grades = (slice.percentage * 360) / 100;
    const midAngle = startAngle + grades / 2;
    const radians = (midAngle - 90) * (Math.PI / 180); 

    const labelX = centerX + radius * Math.cos(radians); 
    const labelY = centerY + radius * Math.sin(radians); 

    const pathData = {
      start: startAngle,
      grades,
      color: slice.color,
      name: slice.name,
      label: {
        x: labelX,
        y: labelY,
        angle: midAngle,
      },
    };
    startAngle += grades;
    return pathData;
  });
}

function completeInnerData(data) {
  let startAngle = 0;
  const radius = innerRadius + innerThickness / 2; 

  return data.flatMap((slice) => {
    const sliceAngle = (slice.percentage * 360) / 100;
    let innerStartAngle = startAngle;

    return slice.subcategories.map((subslice) => {
      const subGrades = (subslice.percentage * sliceAngle) / 100;
      const midAngle = innerStartAngle + subGrades / 2; 
      const radians = (midAngle - 90) * (Math.PI / 180); 

      const labelX = centerX + radius * Math.cos(radians); 
      const labelY = centerY + radius * Math.sin(radians); 

      const pathData = {
        start: innerStartAngle,
        grades: subGrades,
        color: subslice.color,
        name: subslice.name,
        label: {
          x: labelX,
          y: labelY,
          angle: midAngle,
        },
      };
      startAngle += subGrades;
      innerStartAngle += subGrades;
      return pathData;
    });
  });
}

  </script>
  <script
    type="plugin"
    src="https://cdn.graphery.online/graphane/1.0.0-beta/plugins/shapes.js"
  ></script>
</g-composer>

title: pacman
code:
<g-composer>
  <template>
<svg xmlns="http://www.w3.org/2000/svg" version="1.1" class="pacman" viewBox="0 0 600 300">
      <!-- In order to externalize the SVG for use as an object, we have to put all the necessary styling inline here. -->
      <style>
        .pacman-dot {
          fill: black;
        }

        .pacman-open,
        .pacman-mouth-top,
        .pacman-mouth-bottom {
          fill: gold;
        }

        .pacman-mouth-top,
        .pacman-mouth-bottom {
          animation-duration: 175ms;
          animation-timing-function: linear;
          animation-direction: alternate;
          animation-iteration-count: infinite;
          transform-origin: calc(300px/2) 150px; // center of circle
        }

        .pacman-mouth-top {
          animation-name: rotate-counterclockwise;
        }

        .pacman-mouth-bottom {
          animation-name: rotate-clockwise;
        }

        @keyframes rotate-counterclockwise {
          100% {
            transform: rotate(-30deg);
          }
        }

        @keyframes rotate-clockwise {
          100% {
            transform: rotate(30deg);
          }
        }


        .pacman-dot {
          animation-name: dot-motion;
          animation-duration: 600ms;
          animation-timing-function: linear;
          animation-iteration-count: infinite;
        }

        @keyframes dot-motion {
          100% {
            transform: translateX(-100px); // distance between dots
          }
        }
      </style>
      <circle class="pacman-dot" cx="250" cy="50%" r="10" />
      <circle class="pacman-dot" cx="350" cy="50%" r="10" />
      <circle class="pacman-dot" cx="450" cy="50%" r="10" />
      <circle class="pacman-dot" cx="550" cy="50%" r="10" />
      <circle class="pacman-dot" cx="650" cy="50%" r="10" />
      <!-- Create arcs covering 45°, so there's a little overlap with animations of 30°. -->
      <path class="pacman-mouth-bottom" d="
        M 150,150
        L 220.4,221.0
        A 100 100 0 0 0 250,150
        Z" />
      <path class="pacman-mouth-top" d="
        M 150,150 
        L 220.4,79.0
        A 100 100 0 0 1 250,150
        Z" />
      <path class="pacman-open" d="
        M 150,150
        L 236.6,100
        A 100 100 0 1 0 236.6,200
        Z" />
    </svg>
  </template>
  <script type="data">
  </script>
</g-composer>

title: line chart by graphane-gpt
code:
<g-composer>
  <template>
    <svg width="200" height="150">
      <path 
        g-bind:d="generateLinePath(data)" 
        fill="none" 
        stroke="steelblue" 
        stroke-width="2"
      />
      <g g-for="(point, index) of data">
        <circle 
          g-bind:cx="20 + index * 50"
          g-bind:cy="150 - point.value * 5"
          r="5"
          fill="steelblue"
          g-on:mouseover="highlight"
          g-on:mouseout="unhighlight"
        />
        <text 
          g-bind:x="20 + index * 50" 
          g-bind:y="150 - point.value * 5 - 10"
          fill="black" 
          font-size="12px"
          text-anchor="middle"
          g-content="point.label"
        ></text>
      </g>
    </svg>
  </template>
  <script type="data">
    [
      { "label": "A", "value": 10 },
      { "label": "B", "value": 20 },
      { "label": "C", "value": 15 }
    ]
  </script>
  <script type="methods">
    function generateLinePath(data) {
      const pathD = data.map((point, index) => {
        const x = 20 + index * 50;
        const y = 150 - point.value * 5;
        return index === 0 ? `M${x},${y}` : `L${x},${y}`;
      }).join(" ");
      return pathD;
    }
    function highlight() {
      this.r(7);
      this.fill('orange');
    }
    function unhighlight() {
      this.r(5);
      this.fill('steelblue');
    }
  </script>
</g-composer>

title: sumBefore example by graphane-gpt
code:
<g-composer>
  <template>
    <svg width="200" height="200" viewBox="-1 -1 2 2">
      <g g-for="(slice, index) of data">
        <path 
          g-bind:d="$$.M(0, 0)
                    .L($$.C($$.Cos($$.sumBefore(index) * (2 * Math.PI) / 100), $$.Sin($$.sumBefore(index) * (2 * Math.PI) / 100))
                    .L($$.C($$.Cos(($$.sumBefore(index) + slice.value) * (2 * Math.PI) / 100), $$.Sin(($$.sumBefore(index) + slice.value) * (2 * Math.PI) / 100)))
                    .Z()"
          g-bind:fill="slice.color"
          g-on:mouseover="highlight"
          g-on:mouseout="unhighlight"
        ></path>
      </g>
    </svg>
  </template>

  <script type="data">[
      { label: 'A', value: 30, color: 'red' },
      { label: 'B', value: 50, color: 'blue' },
      { label: 'C', value: 20, color: 'green' }
    ]</script>

  <script type="methods">
    function highlight() {
      this.fill = 'orange';
    }
    function unhighlight() {
      // assuming the slice color property is accessible
      const index = this.index; // Assuming `index` is stored in the context for each slice
      this.fill = data[index].color; // Reset to original color
    }
  </script>
</g-composer>

title: wrong donut
code:
<g-composer>
 <template>
    <svg viewBox="0 0 100 100">
      <g g-for="(slice, index) of data">
        <path g-bind:d="$$.barArc(50, 50, 20, 10, slice.endAngle, slice.startAngle)" 
              :fill="slice.color" 
              stroke="white" 
              stroke-width="1"></path>
        <text :x="slice.labelX" :y="slice.labelY" text-anchor="middle" font-size="3" fill="black" g-content="slice.flavor"></text>
      </g>
    </svg>
  </template>
  <script type="data">
    [
      { "flavor": "Chocolate", "percentage": 35, "startAngle": 0, "endAngle": 126, "color": "#FF6384" },
      { "flavor": "Vanilla", "percentage": 30, "startAngle": 126, "endAngle": 252, "color": "#36A2EB" },
      { "flavor": "Strawberry", "percentage": 15, "startAngle": 252, "endAngle": 315, "color": "#FFCE56" },
      { "flavor": "Mint Chocolate Chip", "percentage": 10, "startAngle": 315, "endAngle": 360, "color": "#4BC0C0" },
      { "flavor": "Cookies and Cream", "percentage": 5, "startAngle": 360, "endAngle": 390, "color": "#9966FF" },
      { "flavor": "Other", "percentage": 5, "startAngle": 390, "endAngle": 420, "color": "#FF9F40" }
    ]
  </script>
  <script type="methods">
    function data(originalData) {
      // Calculate angles and positions for labels
      let total = originalData.reduce((sum, slice) => sum + slice.percentage, 0);
      let accumulatedAngle = 0;

      return originalData.map(slice => {
        const startAngle = accumulatedAngle;
        const endAngle = accumulatedAngle + (slice.percentage / total) * 360;

        // Calculate label positions
        const labelAngle = (startAngle + endAngle) / 2;
        const radius = 25; // Halfway between inner and outer radius
        const labelX = 50 + radius * Math.cos((labelAngle - 90) * Math.PI / 180);
        const labelY = 50 + radius * Math.sin((labelAngle - 90) * Math.PI / 180);

        accumulatedAngle = endAngle;

        return {
          ...slice,
          startAngle: startAngle,
          endAngle: endAngle,
          labelX: labelX,
          labelY: labelY
        };
      });
    }
  </script>
  <script type="plugin" src="https://cdn.graphery.online/graphane/1.0.0-beta/plugins/shapes.js"></script>
</g-composer>

title: Multi bar chart
code:
<g-composer>
  <template>
    <svg viewBox="0 0 600 600" width="600" height="600" style="font-family:Arial;">
      <!-- Y-axis labels -->
      <g g-for="yAxis of [0, 200, 400, 600, 800, 1000]">
        <text
          x="50"
          :y="555 - yAxis / 2"
          text-anchor="end"
          fill="grey"
          font-size="12pt"
          g-content="yAxis"
        >
        </text>
      </g>
 
      <!-- Bars -->
      <g g-for="(bar, index) of data">
        <g g-for="(section, i) of bar.sections">
           <rect
            :x="100 + index * 100"
            :y="550 - calculateHeight(bar, i) / 2"
            :width="50"
            :height="section.height / 2"
            :fill="section.color"
          ></rect>
        </g>
        <text
          :x="120 + index * 100"
          y="580"
          text-anchor="center"
          fill="#263252"
          font-weight="700"
          font-size="12pt"
          g-content="bar.label"
        >
      </g>
    </svg>
  </template>
  
  <script type="methods">
    function calculateHeight(bar, index) {
      let cumulative = 0;
      for (let i = 0; i <= index; i++) {
        cumulative += bar.sections[i].height;
      }
      return cumulative;
    }
  </script>
  
  <script type="data">
  [
    {
       label:"A",
       totalHeight:850,
       sections: [
         {height:200, color:'#263252'}, 
         {height:200, color:'#C3202F'},
         {height:200, color:'#E72C35'},
         {height:250, color:'#FF3F34'}
       ]
    },

     {
       label:"B",
       totalHeight:650,
       sections: [
         {height:200, color:'#263252'},
         {height:150, color:'#C3202F'},
         {height:150, color:'#E72C35'},
         {height:150, color:'#FF3F34'}
       ]
    },

     {
       label:"C",
       totalHeight:500,
       sections: [
         {height:200, color:'#263252'},
         {height:100, color:'#C3202F'},
         {height:100, color:'#E72C35'},
         {height:100, color:'#FF3F34'}
       ] 
    },

     {
       label:"D",
       totalHeight:750,
       sections: [
         {height:200, color:'#263252'},
         {height:200, color:'#C3202F'},
         {height:150, color:'#E72C35'},
         {height:200, color:'#FF3F34'}
       ] 
    }]
  </script>
</g-composer>

title: horizontal bar char
code:
<g-composer id="horizontal-bar-chart">
  <template>
    <svg width="400" height="200">
      <g g-for="(item, index) of data">
        <rect g-bind:y="index * 40" g-bind:height="30" g-bind:width="item.value" g-bind:fill="item.color"></rect>
      </g>
    </svg>
  </template>
  <script type="data">
    [
      { color: "#D80000", value: 100 },
